She donated a kidney for her sister, Sally. After Sally's surgery, several members of their family came to visit.

'''A.J. Morris''' was a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who had cancer.



A.J.'s cancer continued to spread even with treatment. Because he was too weak for surgery, [[Miranda Bailey]] suggested genome mapping to make a targeted therapy to treat him. However, the hospital denied their request to have A.J.'s genome mapped by a lab, Arizona said that they'd wait a day for him to improve and then operate, but Dr. Bailey encouraged Ike to take his son elsewhere for the treatment.



His father, Ike, was at the hospital with him.

'''Alice Franklin''' is the daughter of [[Jordan Franklin]].


Alice's father, Jordan, came into the hospital with an enlarged abdomen. He was admitted for tests. He had fluid in his abdomen due to his liver disease that was pressing on his lung. The liver disease was caused by his frequent alcohol consumption. Izzie and Cristina did a paracentesis to drain the fluid. They were nervous about the procedure as neither of them had done one before, but they did it anyway. They drained a significant amount of fluid and then noticed that he had no pulse. They called a code, but they were unable to save him.

Worried that they might have done something wrong, they did an autopsy even though they were unable to convince the family to ask for one. Bailey interrupted their autopsy, but by then, they'd discovered that his heart was enlarged. They took a sample of the grainy material inside his heart to run tests. They discovered hemochromatosis, which had caused his death and had made him sick for many years prior to then. They informed the family and mentioned that it was genetic and so his daughter, Alice, might have it. They family then agreed to sign the consent form for the autopsy.



She is close with her mother, but resented her father heavily because she thought he was always sick because of the drinking. However, after his death, it was revealed that he had hemochromatosis, which caused his sickness.

[[es:Alice Franklin]]

'''Alicia Tatum''' is a patient who had mysterious symptoms and was ultimately diagnosed with porphyria.


Alicia came into the hospital with a fever and pain three months after an oophorectomy. Her workup showed gallstones and wall thickening, so she had laparoscopic surgery to remove them. She was hoping that would relieve her pain, which was constant. During her surgery, they noted that high-fat diets can cause gallstones, but [[Miranda Bailey]] informed them that she was vegan. She'd started a vegan diet when she realized it helped with the acid reflux she'd had for most of her life.

A month later, Alicia came back to the ER with symptoms consistent with appendicitis. However, when she opened Alicia's abdomen, she found a healthy appendix. Despite this, she removed it and closed. [[Nicole Baylow]] wrote her off as a drug seeker and wanted to get her a psych consult, but after [[Richard Webber]] questioned that treatment plan, she went by what Bailey had suggested and tested for lupus and other rare disorders. The tests were all negative, so Alicia was sent home again.

Alicia came back to the hospital a few months later. Baylow thought she had an obstruction and wanted to take her in for surgery to take a closer look, but Bailey noticed that her urine was intermittently dark and had other symptoms consistent with porphyria. She only had a pseudo-obstruction. They started her on hemin for the porphyria, which improved her condition.



She had an ex-boyfriend who was a vegan chef. He broke up with her after her oophorectomy.


*[[Miranda Bailey]] lectured about her case at Lecture Day.

Swender then started IL- and after two treatments, her mets were gone. However, while she was in the hospital, she coded and had to be rushed into surgery. They looked desperately for a bowel perforation, but didn't find anything. They resected a portion of her bowel, but were unable to finish the surgery because she was too unstable. She was unable to come off the ventilator after her surgery and her parents and boyfriend were told she wouldn't wake up.



She had a boyfriend who came to see her when she had her final surgery.


Her parents came to the hospital after her surgery. They were informed that she wouldn't wake up.


While they were undergoing chemotherapy together, Alison became friends with [[Izzie Stevens]].

'''Alison Clark''' is a woman who had a stroke after surgery to remove her cancer.



While at the grocery store with her husband, Alison collapsed. She was anemic and they determined that she had internal bleeding coming from her tumor. [[Rebecca Swender]] had told them that Alison's cancer was back, but that they may be able to remove it. [[Richard Webber]] promised them he'd do everything he could. In surgery, Webber believed he could do a local resection. The surgery went well and her husband was told they got good margins and she'd be okay.

However, when [[April Kepner]] went to wean her off the ventilator, she wasn't breathing on her own, so April had to restore previous vent settings. Richard suspected a stroke and had her run a CT and an EEG. She had a stroke and a large bleed. There was nothing they could do as she was already brain dead. Her husband was told that she'd never wake up. He wanted them to leave the ventilators on, but the advanced directive she'd signed three years before when she was first diagnosed with cancer specifically said she wanted no mechanical ventilation. They had a meeting where he tried to get them to keep the machines on, but the ethics committee reviewed the case and determined that her advanced directive stood, so they turned the machines off and Alison died.


After her death, her husband filed a lawsuit against the hospital. ''("[[How Insensitive]]")''



She and [[Gary Clark]] were married for  years before her death.

[[de:Alison Clark]]

'''Andrew Langston''' came into the hospital after jumping in a vat of cement.


Andrew was dared to jump into a vat of cement at a construction site, which he did. The firefighters chipped around him, but had to bring him in with a large amount of cement still around him. The doctors carefully evaluated his condition in order to figure out where to start first. They then each argued that the injuries related to their specialty should be treated first.

They eventually started work. Mark put vinegar on his skin to minimize the burning. While they were working, Bailey assured him that more than just this one piece defines him. Callie had to do a fasciotomy to relive the pressure in his leg. They then started to remove the larger pieces of cement to get him out. Bailey figured out that they were missing something, but she couldn't figure it out. She thought about it and remembered that they'd hydrated him, but hadn't given him a way to release the urine, so they needed to place a catheter before his bladder exploded. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''

They finished breaking up the cement and Andrew was warned that there was a chance that when they removed the last chunk, he'd crash. But he was assured that he'd be okay because they'd rush him to the OR. They removed the final piece and he crashed. They intubated and then rushed him into surgery to fix his injuries. He had a pulmonary embolus, so Richard said to page Hahn, but Cristina said she could take care of it and he allowed her to do it. They finished his surgery successful and he was stable post-op.

Andrew woke up from surgery and Lola came to his room to visit him and kissed him. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''



He had a crush on [[Lola (Freedom)|Lola]]. He lay in the vat of cement because she was watching. He wanted to impress her. After his surgery, she came to sit by his bedside and kissed him.


*He was  at the time of his accident.
*He tutors and is on the Dean's list.

'''Andrew Willis''' is a patient who was a spelling bee champion.


Andrew was diagnosed with a very large brain tumor. He came into the hospital to have awake brain surgery to remove the tumor.

While they were operating, the doctors made conversation with him to check his awareness and gauge when they got too close to the language center of the brain. As he was a champion speller getting ready for the national spelling bee, they tested him by having him spell several medical words. At one point, his speech started to slur, but he started speaking normally after they backed out of that area. They were then able to remove the whole tumor.

After surgery, he was stable and awake, but he had no memory of the surgery whatsoever.


*He was in th grade at the time of his tumor resection.

Archie came into the ER with burns after being an explosion in his building. He also had a broken arm. His burns were debrided in the the ER.

When they found out that the explosion was caused by a meth lab, the doctors asked Archie if he'd been using meth, which he said he wasn't. He was then taken into surgery to reduce his arm. He was stable and awake after his surgery.



[[Dave Kristler|Dave]] and [[Marla Kristler]] live upstairs from him. They're very close and he sometimes babysat their son, [[Brian Kristler|Brian]]. He was concerned when they were all hospitalized and disappointed when he learned that Marla and Dave had been cooking meth in their apartment.

}}
'''Ariel Williams''' is the sister of [[Rory Williams]].



Her mom's family has a history of repeated cancer, which manifested in her sister, [[Rory Williams|Rory]].


Rory had brain cancer at age ten which was fully cured. However, when Rory was sixteen, she was diagnosed with osteosarcoma and was also discovered to have a tumor in her chest.


Rory having three cancers by age sixteen and the family history of prominent cancer diagnoses prompted [[Miranda Bailey]] to look for a genetic reason. She discovered a mutation of the P gene and concluded that the family carried Li-Fraumeni Syndrome, which affects their bodies' ability to regulate cell growth.


Rory became unresponsive and wasn\ut breathing properly, so she was rushed into surgery. Despite the doctors' best efforts, Rory bled out into her chest and died. When the doctors came to tell the Williams family, they were distraught and it prompted Ariel to ask the doctors if she also had Li-Fraumeni, which she did.



Parents
Ariel gets along well with her parents, though she was exasperated at their desire to set up a foundation for Li-Fraumeni in their family's name.

[[Rory Williams]]
Ariel got along well with her sister and even joked with her that her cancer was getting them both out of finals and had previously gotten them a puppy. When Rory died, it gave Ariel the push she needed to know whether or not she had the same syndrome Rory had. When it turned out that she did, she said it was good because she'd always wanted to be just like Rory.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Williams, Ariel}}

'''Athena''' is the ex-girlfriend of [[JP]].


When she tried to leave her boyfriend, JP, he took her keys and swallowed them in order to stop her from leaving. However, the keys got stuck in his esophagus. He continued to argue with Athena as Izzie stuck a bronchoscope down his throat to get the keys. When she finally reached them, the keys fell down a few more inches, making it hard for him to breathe. The keys were then quickly retrieved and Izzie handed them over to Athena, advising her to leave.



Athena was seeing JP. Their relationship ended when he called her therapist pretending to be his therapist, trying to find out what she'd been saying about him. He swallowed her keys to keep her from leaving, but they got caught in his throat. Once her keys were retrieved, she left him.


*She sees a therapist.
*She makes more money than [[JP]].

'''Betty Johnson''' came into the hospital after being in a car accident with her family.


While in town for their daughter, Melanie's, baby shower, Betty was in a car with her husband, Jim, when [[Marshall Stone]] fell asleep at the wheel and hit them, causing them to hit the car in front of them, which held Melanie and her husband, Noah. In the ER, Betty said she had pain in her leg and arm.

Alex went to examine her, but she said she wasn't wearing any panties, so she asked for a female doctor. Her scans were clear, so she was quickly discharged.

Melanie had much more serious injuries, her parents waited at the hospital while they took her into surgery. They later informed that Melanie's injuries were catastrophic. Betty and Jim waited with Noah in his room while the doctors took her into surgery. After she reached the triangle of death, they moved her to the ICU, where she stayed until they were ready to take her back into surgery. Unfortunately, she died during the second surgery and her baby had to be delivered. After some initial trouble breathing, the baby was stable in the NICU and Noah sat next to the incubator.



She is married to [[Jim Johnson]]. They had one daughter together, [[Melanie Reynolds|Melanie]].


Betty was very close to her daughter, Melanie, saying that Melanie asked her advice on everything.


*She really liked [[Callie Torres]].

'''Bob Seibert''' is a man who was in a car accident caused by his own road rage.


Bob was driving when he was cut off. That provoked him to start chasing the other driver, which caused an accident. The driver of the other car involved died and Bob and his wife and son were taken to the hospital. Bob had the most serious injuries, which were complicated by his pre-existing liver failure. He was taken into surgery, where they worked to repair the damage, but they determined that he wouldn't survive the surgery without a liver transplant. His son, [[Scott Seibert|Scott]], had been tested and matched as a living donor, but hadn't made a decision. After hearing that his father would die without it, he agreed to donate, but only on the condition that he and his mother would move out and she'd tell the police what had actually happened and about all the abuse in their house. His transplant went well and his surgery was completed.



He is married to [[Lea Seibert]], whom he abuses.


His son, Scott, donated a portion of his liver to him. He was initially reluctant to do so because Bob was beating his wife.


*He was  at the time of his car accident.

'''Brad Ackles''' was injured when [[Petey]], whom he had fired, came back to their workplace with a gun.



Sometime prior to the shooting, Brad fired Petey for unknown reasons.


After being fired, Petey came into the restaurant with a gun, aiming to shoot Brad. Brad got out of the way by diving through a window. He had several lacerations from glass, but was not shot. In the ER, [[Izzie Stevens]] carefully removed the shards of glass from him and bandaged him up.

When [[Will ( Seconds)|Will]] became annoyed at hearing Brad brag about not being in much pain, [[Miranda Bailey]] talked to him, explaining that his injuries were minor and he needed to stop because he was upsetting other people.

Brad apologized to Will and said he'd talk to the owners and get him the time off to recover. While he was leaving the hospital, Petey returned and shot and killed Brad.



His employees do not like him very much. When he fired [[Petey]], Petey came back with a gun to shoot him.


Brad is the manager of a restaurant.


*He's an athlete.

'''Brett Hayes''' is the father of [[Jamie Hayes]].


He and his wife noticed that their daughter's foot was twitching periodically, so they took her to County Hospital. They ran a CT which revealed a brain abnormality, so they referred the family to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. Derek ran an MRI and diagnosed Rasmussen's encephalitis. Half of Jamie's brain had died and needed to be removed to prevent the condition from spreading.

In her surgery, her anesthesiologist, who had been drinking, nodded off and Jamie started to wake up. They were able to rouse him and he put Jamie back out, but Derek told him to leave the OR after he was replaced by another anesthesiologist. Jamie's surgery was completed successfully.



He is married to [[Gwen Hayes]]. Together they have a daughter.


He has a daughter, Jamie, who was hospitalized for brain surgery.

'''Brian''' is a kid who came into the hospital after swallowing a marble.


Brian's parents brought him into the clinic after he swallowed a marble. [[George O'Malley]] examined him and said they'd just have to wait for it to pass. Having been told that he could get whatever he wanted after going to the hospital, Brian asked his parents to get a divorce. They fought all the time and put him in the middle. They dismissed his request. The marble passed that night.

The next day, the brought him in with severe abdominal pain. He said he'd swallowed eight more marbles, but when he spit some up, George saw that he'd actually swallowed eight magnets. One of the magnets had perforated his bowel and the magnets were still moving inside him. They rushed him into surgery and removed the magnets and repaired the damage they had caused. After his surgery, his mother was told he'd be okay.



His parents fought all the time and put him in the middle. Because of this, he wanted them to get a divorce and made himself sick so they'd take him seriously.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He was a colicky baby.

'''Brian Kristler''' is a patient who came in after his parents' meth lab blew up.


Brian came into the ER with a possible head injury after an explosion in his home. A CT scan showed no acute injury, but Alex smelled meth on him, so he said he needed to run more tests and ordered an MRI and a tox screen, which revealed that he'd ingested meth, probably due to it coating the floors and walls of his home when his parents were making it. He started to go into withdrawal at the hospital. When his father found out the doctors knew he'd been cooking meth, he tried to take Brian and hide, but they were discovered in the bathroom attached to his mother's hospital room, limp in his father's arms. He'd had a stroke, so he was rushed into surgery. His surgery went well and his grandmother came to take custody of him because his parents were being arrested.



Brian's mother, [[Marla Kristler|Marla]], and his father, [[Dave Kristler|Dave]], were running a meth lab in their apartment. It blew up, sending the family to Seattle Grace Hospital.

Brian has a grandmother who took care of him after his parents were taken into custody.


[[Archie Roche]] sometimes babysat him and was shocked to learn about the meth lab.


He was  months old at the time of his surgery.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Kristler, Brian}}

'''Brooke Blanchard''' is a woman who got burned while pregnant during the train crash.



Brooke and her friend, Jana, whom she'd known since third grade, decided they wanted to be parents, but they didn't have romantic partners, so they decided to find a sperm donor, get pregnant, and they'd raise their children together.


When they were nine months pregnant, Jana and Brooke were in a train crash. Jana had only a laceration that needed stitches, but Brooke was seriously burned. While she was being treated for her burns, Brooke went into labor and was told she'd need a c-section because her burns meant she was in no condition to push. Brooke asked for a lawyer, so she could sign paperwork ensuring that their son would go to Jana if she died. While she was in surgery, Jana labored and delivered her baby.



She and Jana have a son and a daughter together.


She and Jana have been best friends since third grade. When they decided they wanted children, they found a sperm donor and decided to raise their kids together. She gave birth to their son while Jana gave birth to their daughter.

'''Carl Murphy''' is a patient who was treated with leeches for multiple melanomas.


Carl was admitted to the hospital with multiple melanomas. He'd had reconstructive surgery for his ear, nose, and left index finger. He had slow capillary refill, so they used leeches to help his blood flow.

While trying to attach the leeches, [[Olivia Jankovic|Olivia]] was nervous, so the leeches wouldn't attach. George took over and go them to bite and start working. The leeches did their job and Carl was on his way to recovery. He asked to take the leeches home with him, as he wanted to release them near his house to thank them for helping him.



He's divorced, but still wears a wedding ring.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He has been hiking for over  years and loves the outdoors.
*He named the leech George attached "O'Malley." The others he named Isabella and Darcy.

'''Carly Height''' is a woman who was injured in the ferry boat crash.


Carly was in the ferry crash. She had a large abdominal injury, but refused to be examined or sent to the hospital because her seven year old son was still missing. [[George O'Malley]] took the picture of her son and said he'd find her son while she went to the hospital to get treated.

At the hospital, she was rushed into surgery. However, she didn't want to be put under until she knew her son was safe. ''("[[Walk on Water]]")''

George lied and said that he'd found her son in order to get her to agree to have surgery. When confronted about his lie, he said he was okay with it if his lie helped save her life.

In surgery, Bailey found out that the damage missed all major organs and was able to repair the damage quickly. While she was in surgery, George found her son. ''("[[Drowning on Dry Land]]")''



She has a seven year old son named Christopher. When she was in the ferry crash, she refused to have surgery until she knew her son was okay.


*She was  at the time of the ferry boat crash.

'''Caroline Klein''' is the mother of [[Hannah Klein]].


Caroline and her husband, Dustin, came to the hospital when their daughter, Hannah, was diagnosed with cancer. They had a bone marrow donor lined up, but the donor died, so they decided to look up Hannah's birth mother, [[Izzie Stevens]], as a possible match. They approached her and asked if she'd donate despite being only a half-match. She agreed, but asked to see Hannah. Her parents went and asked her, but she said she was too tired. Izzie then went to have her bone marrow extracted to donate to Hannah.



She is married to [[Dustin Klein]].


She has one daughter, Hannah. When Hannah was diagnosed with leukemia, her parents brought her to Seattle Grace in order to find her biological mother, [[Izzie Stevens]], to see if she'd be willing to donate bone marrow.

Celeste came to the hospital with her boss when he was hospitalized. She said that she should be tested because if he had something, she probably had it as well. Addison ran the tests, but the results were all negative. When Larry got out of surgery, [[Nancy Jennings]] asked [[George O'Malley]] to tell Celeste, because she was worried about him. Celeste later came into Larry's room and told him she'd rescheduled his meetings for the next week and asked Danny to step in. She then left him. She was sleeping with her boss, Larry. They'd been seeing each other for five years and he still hadn't left his wife. She stayed with him anyway, saying it's rare to find someone you can work and play with. However, after his surgery, she asked Danny to step in to take over and left Larry. She was Larry's administrative assistant. However, after his surgery, she quit her job along with leaving him. {{DEFAULTSORT:Newman, Celeste}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Patients]] [[Category:Patients (OB/GYN)]]

'''Cheryl Leonard''' is the ex-wife of [[Holden McKee]].



While working as a firefighter, Cheryl's husband, Holden, was hit by falling debris. As a result of this accident, he was believed to be in a permanent vegetative state and he was put in residential care.


Sixteen years later, Holden fell in his nursing home while being turned by orderlies and insurance insisted that he be checked out in an ER before he could be returned to the home. While she was examining him and preparing to stitch up a cut on his forehead, Meredith was startled to see him open his eyes and track her. She told Derek what she saw and he was doubtful. Despite his doubts, he examined Holden, who was found to be minimally conscious. Derek gave him amphetamines to wake him up.

They also called his family as they waited for him to wake up. When the family arrived, they discovered that his son was now a teenager and his wife had re-married and was expecting a baby. When they heard that Holden was likely to wake up soon, Cheryl took [[Coby McKee|Coby]] and left, not wanting Holden to see that they hadn't waited for him.

After they left, Holden woke up and was shocked to hear how much time had passed. He had an MRI, which revealed an epidural hematoma. They said they could operate, but told Holden it was risky. Coby came back, but didn't stay long. After he left, Holden decided to have the surgery. They operated, but he died during the surgery. Meredith then had to deliver the news to Coby, who had come back to the hospital to wait for his dad.



[[Holden McKee]]
Cheryl was married to Holden McKee and they had one son together. When their son was a toddler, Holden was injured and had to be put in a nursing home. At some point, Cheryl divorced Holden and remarried.

[[Hal Leonard]]
At some point while Holden was in the nursing home, Cheryl re-married to Hal Leonard. They were also expecting a child together.


She has one son, [[Coby McKee|Coby]] and is expecting another child.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Leonard, Cheryl}}

'''Cheyenne Wood''' is a teenager who was pregnant with a baby that had a large spinal tumor.


Cheyenne was pregnant with a baby that had a tumor on her neck that was causing a build-up of amniotic fluid and obstructing her airway and her spine. Addison planned an EXIT surgery. They removed the baby partially to operate because the tumor was obstructing her airway. That would allow her to keep getting oxygen through the umbilical cord while they removed the tumor.

While Cheyenne was waiting for her surgery, she was reading Shakespeare to the baby. Izzie talked to her and suggested adoption as an option to her, knowing that it's not something that's discussed where they come from.

After the surgery, Cheyenne held the baby and talked to Izzie about her experience giving her baby up for adoption.



Cheyenne was raised by her mother in a trailer park. When Cheyenne was pregnant, she was supposed to start saving up to get her own trailer for her and the baby.


She has a friend named Shelly who lives in the same trailer park where [[Izzie Stevens]] grew up.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Wood, Cheyenne}}

'''Cindy Thomas''' is the mother of [[Kendra Thomas]].


Cindy's daughter, Kendra, was working at a restaurant when she was shot in the head. She was taken for a CT. [[George O'Malley|George]] informed [[Derek Shepherd|Derek]] that she was also pregnant. Her fetus was  weeks and healthy.

Derek took Kendra into surgery. He tried helping her, but she was pronounced brain dead. Her parents were told about her condition and they asked about the baby. They wanted to know if they could keep Kendra on life support in order to keep the baby alive long enough for her to deliver.

Addison advised the parents that it was a very bad decision, as there were multiple ways it could go wrong, but they were not convinced.

George later spoke to them and said that from what he had heard about Kendra, she would want to save other lives by letting her organs be donated. He asked them to consider that. They decided to donate her organs.



She is married to [[Doug Thomas]]. They have one daughter together, Kendra.


When her daughter was pronounced brain dead, she and her husband were devastated. They initially wanted to keep her on life support so her pregnancy could continue, but decided not to when reminded that Kendra liked to help people and her organs could save many lives.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Thomas, Cindy}}

'''Claire''' is a surgical resident at [[Seattle Grace Hospital|Seattle Grace Hospital.]] When she was an intern, her resident was [[Izzie Stevens]].



On her first day of internship, she was assigned to [[Izzie Stevens]], who took the group on a tour of the hospital and used the same new intern speech that Bailey had used for her class to introduce them to the rules. Her interns viewed her as the dud, having heard that she'd spent some time on probation after killing someone.

After they spent the day saving a deer with Izzie, she said that they were the dud interns.

At the end of the day, all the new interns were in awe of George, who had delivered a baby that day, on what they all thought was his first ever shift as an intern. ''("[[A Change is Gonna Come]]")''


When the rumor spread that Callie and Izzie were going to fight in the hospital cafeteria, the interns, along with several other hospital staffers, gathered to watch it happen. However, Callie hadn't intended to fight and the interns were disappointed, calling it a forfeit on Callie's part. ''("[[The Heart of the Matter]]")''


Claire, Graciella, Leo, and Mitch all attended a housewarming party thrown by George and Lexie. They all ended up coming to work drunk the next day. ''("[[Piece of My Heart]]")''


The night after the party, the interns planned a darts tournament. When George invited Izzie, they started considering dropping out because they didn't want to play darts with their boss. ''("[[Piece of My Heart]]")''


When [[George O'Malley]] became a resident and the other residents had to choose an intern each to give to him, they lined all the interns up in the cafeteria and discussed their pros and cons right in front of them as they decided. ''("[[There's No 'I' in Team]]")''


Owen stabbed four pigs as part of a skills lab and the interns and residents worked to keep them alive. ''("[[Life During Wartime]]")''


Wanting to remind the interns, who were still on probation, why they loved medicine, [[Izzie Stevens]] put together a medical contest for them, which involved diagnosing patients based on symptoms presented to them and draping patients for specific surgeries. ''("[[Before and After]]")''


The interns worked on Patient X (actually Izzie using her own scans and labs) and presented a few ideas to Izzie. After more tests, they decided that Patient X was fine before Izzie told them she was not fine. At the end of the day, they presented their final diagnosis: metastatic melanoma, with mets to the skin, liver, and brain. Her prognosis was very poor. They asked Izzie what their prize was, but she said the prize is that they didn't screw it up. ''("[[I Will Follow You Into the Dark]]")''


When [[David Young]] came into the hospital for his face transplant, the interns were prepared for his surgery and were told they'd likely never see another one again. ''("[[Stand By Me]]")''


When Izzie went into surgery to have the mets removed from her brain, the interns waited outside the OR. The residents let them because people are better than no people. ''("[[Elevator Love Letter]]")''


When George died, Claire attended the funeral. ''("[[Good Mourning]]")''


When the merger between [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] and [[Mercy West Medical Center]] was announced, the interns all began working around the clock, because they were scared to go home out of fear that they'd end up getting cut from the program. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")''


Claire was a surgical resident at Seattle Grace Hospital. When she was an intern, she was assigned to [[Izzie Stevens]].

While the residents were deciding which one of their interns to give to [[George O'Malley|George]], Izzie revealed that Claire almost castrated a guy with a catheter.

Since she was never seen again after the first round of cutbacks, it's likely she was part of the / of her class cut. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")''


*She once almost castrated a guy with a catheter.<ref>[[There's No 'I' in Team]], x</ref>

'''Claire Rice''' is a patient who had complications after having gastric bypass surgery in Mexico.



Claire went on a trip to Mexico with her friends as a freshman in college. While she was there, she had gastric bypass surgery because she felt pressure from her mother to be thinner.


Three weeks later, Claire came into the ER after passing out in the shower. She had a fever and abdominal pain. Her parents believed she had just gotten an infection from her trip, but when she was examined, four scars were present on her abdomen. She wouldn't say what they were from, but her scans revealed that she'd had gastric bypass and it was done poorly. She had an abscess and swelling in her bowel. They did the surgery and reversed the bypass, but they had to remove a large portion of her bowel, meaning she'd struggle to get proper nutrition for the rest of her life.



Claire's mother put immense pressure on her to be thin, which led her to get gastric bypass surgery in Mexico.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

'''Claire Solomon''' is a newlywed woman who contracted an infection on her honeymoon that turned out to be necrotizing fasciitis.


While on her honeymoon, Claire ended up in the ER with a rash on her leg that was spreading quickly. They marked the rash to track the spread. It crossed the line within a few minutes of being marked, informing them that it was extremely aggressive. When asked about it, Wade, her husband, said she'd cut her foot on some oyster shells a few days ago while windsurfing in Puget Sound. They took her in to remove the infection, but the lab results showed that it was necrotizing fasciitis. They spoke to Wade and said that amputation was the safest option, but Sydney believed they could cut out the infection and try to keep the leg functional.

Sydney cut out every piece of necrotic tissue she could and said that she believed Claire would be okay after a few runs in a hyperbaric chamber.



She is newly married to [[Wade Solomon]]. After their wedding, they planned an adventure honeymoon that included mountain climbing, windsurfing, and running a K.

'''Clara Ferguson''' was a trauma patient brought to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] after a speed boating accident at Puget Sound amputated both her arms and one leg when she got pulled into the propeller.



Clara was on a plane from Sydney on her way to backpack through the United States when she met [[Jasmine]] and [[Jo]], two girls who would become her traveling mates.

At Puget Sound, Clara got into an accident after being thrown off a speedboat. The propeller pulled her in, and both her arms were neatly amputated and were retrieved from the water by Jasmine. Her right leg was also hanging on by a thread. In the ER, Mark said the amputations were clean and the arms could be re-attached.


After dropping off her backpack, her traveling buddies left while she was in surgery to catch a concert in Las Vegas. Knowing that she would need the support during her recovery, [[Cristina Yang]] ordered [[Lexie Grey]] to befriend Clara and become her support system. Meanwhile, Jasmine and Jo constantly sent Clara postcards of their travels. Clara also refused to tell her mother, who was in London, about her situation and instead lied to her through her e-mails for weeks by telling her about her fake travels, because she didn't want the woman who "built her from scratch" to know how badly she was hurt.


While her arms were reattached, she was unable to move them for days. Clara became depressed when moving her fingers slightly was a big accomplishment. She told Lexie they should have let her die. ''("[[Good Mourning]]")''

Clara later told Lexie she was doing better and she could call off the suicide watch. ''("[[Goodbye]]")''


Clara was told she had an infection in her small bowel and her colon was inflamed, meaning she needed another surgery. She refused surgery because she didn't want to be cut open again. It was the only option. When Lexie read an email she'd composed to Clara's mother, telling her everything that happened, saying that she'd either page the doctors for surgery or hit send, Clara let them take her into surgery. The infection had worsened because of the delay, but they were able to remove a portion of her bowel and she was taken to recovery. ''("[[Goodbye]]")''


After she recovered from her surgery, Clara was fitted with a prosthetic and [[Jon]], a physical therapist, came in to get her up and trying to walk again. She resisted physical therapy. After Jon said that this is where the hard part begins, she refused to continue and wouldn't allow any further sessions. Owen wanted to call for a psych consult, but Lexie said they were calling her ceviche and she couldn't go out like that. She laughed and acknowledged that that was horrible. She then allowed Jon to come back. They got her up and she was able to take a few steps on her prosthetic. She then told Lexie to call her mother. ''("[[Goodbye]]")''



Her mother always told her that she'd made her body from scratch, trying to get her to be more careful with herself. As a result, when she was hospitalized, she didn't call her mother. ''("[[Good Mourning]]")''

After she recovered enough to get up and walking on a prosthetic, she allowed Lexie to call her mother. ''("[[Goodbye]]")''


She met [[Jo]] and [[Jasmine]] on the plane from Sydney to the US. They became traveling companions, but when Clara was injured, they continued on their trip without her and sent her postcards telling her about how fun their trip was. ''("[[Good Mourning]]")''


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.<ref>[[Good Mourning]], x</ref>

'''Clara Greene''' is a diabetic woman who received Webber's first islet cell device.


Clara was in the hospital recovering eight weeks after having a tumor removed. Because she had type one diabetes, her recovery was going slowly. Her insulin levels hadn't stabilized.

Desperate to find a way to help, Bailey suggested Clara being the first candidate in Richard's islet cell device trial. He agreed to apply for an emergency waiver from the FDA while Bailey presented the idea to the Greenes.

When Clara went into a hypoglycemic coma, Richard decided not to wait on the waiver and operated immediately to place the device. Clara stabilized after the surgery and then the waiver came through.



She is married to [[Sean Greene]].


Her kids were living in Iowa with her husband's parents. Sean said that he barely survived that house and hated having to leave his kids there.

'''Clark West''' came into the ER after being in a meth lab explosion.


Clark was buying meth from [[Dave Kristler|Dave]] and [[Marla Kristler]]. As he was leaving, the meth lab exploded. Clark was injured and taken to the ER.

As he got a CAT scan, Clark started breathing heavily. He then coded. [[George O'Malley]] was able to resuscitate him. He was told that he had cardiomyopathy from the drug use and internal bleeding, which meant he couldn't leave the hospital, but he was going to go into withdrawal.

As he went into withdrawal, he told George that he had first taken meth at a party and thought it would be a one-time thing, but it quickly became an addiction. He then coded again and was unable to be resuscitated.

'''Clay Bedonie''' is a patient who thought he was being haunted by the ghost of the person whose heart he received.


Clay had a heart transplant, but the heart was too small, so they piggybacked it with his native heart. Six years later, he needed another heart transplant, but he felt he was being haunted by the ghost of his donor, a girl hit by a car while hitchhiking, so he didn't want it. He just wanted them to remove the old heart and give it to him for a purification ritual.

When he heard that Izzie was being haunted by Denny, he asked that she not work on his case.

They took him into surgery and removed the donor heart. They were shocked when the native heart was beating on its own. The doctors believed the six years of rest had given his heart time to rest and repair itself, but he believed it was because he wasn't haunted anymore.



He says his friend who follow the old ways didn't want him to get the first heart transplant.


*He's a member of the Navajo tribe.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Bedonie, Clay}}

|portrayed by = [[Andrew James Allen]]
}}

'''Coby McKee''' is the son of [[Holden McKee]].



While working as a firefighter, Coby's father, Holden, was hit by falling debris. As a result of this accident, he was believed to be in a permanent vegetative state and he was put in residential care.


Sixteen years later, Holden fell in his nursing home while being turned by orderlies and insurance insisted that he be checked out in an ER before he could be returned to the home. While she was examining him and preparing to stitch up a cut on his forehead, Meredith was startled to see him open his eyes and track her. She told Derek what she saw and he was doubtful. Despite his doubts, he examined Holden, who was found to be minimally conscious. Derek gave him amphetamines to wake him up.

They also called his family as they waited for him to wake up. When the family arrived, they discovered that his son was now a teenager and his wife had re-married and was expecting a baby. When they heard that Holden was likely to wake up soon, [[Cheryl Leonard|Cheryl]] took Coby and left, not wanting Holden to see that they hadn't waited for him.

After they left, Holden woke up and was shocked to hear how much time had passed. He had an MRI, which revealed an epidural hematoma. They said they could operate, but told Holden it was risky. Coby came back, but didn't stay long. After he left, Holden decided to have the surgery. They operated, but he died during the surgery. Meredith then had to deliver the news to Coby, who had come back to the hospital to wait for his dad.



His father, [[Holden McKee]], was in a nursing home for sixteen years, from the time Coby was a toddler. When Coby was a teen, he came out of the state, only to die the same day.

Coby was raised by his mother and stepfather, [[Hal Leonard]]. He says Hal's a good man.

{{DEFAULTSORT:McKee, Coby}}

'''Cynthia''' is a doctor who operates a clinic in Washington close to the border to Idaho.


Cynthia ran a clinic in Pullman, Washington, near the border with Idaho. After Roe v. Wade was overturned, Idaho effectively banned abortion, so many Idaho residents crossed the border to seek care at her clinic. With the help of volunteers, she modified her clinic to accommodate the additional need. Addison and Bailey came to her clinic to help out and she showed them how things operated. When she heard that [[Susan (When I Get to the Border)|Susan]] had an ectopic pregnancy and a doctor who refused to remove it and was across the border, she sent Addison and Bailey to pick her up and bring her back so they could treat her. Unfortunately, Susan hemorrhaged on the way back and died.



She is married. She moved to Pullman because her husband got a job teaching music at the university there.


She and [[Miranda Bailey]] were roommates when they were freshmen in college. Cynthia fit a couch and a mini-fridge into their small dorm.


She is an OB/GYN at Eastern Washington Family Planning Clinic, which has been open for  years.


*She grew up in Chicago.
*Her clinic sees over  patients a year.

'''Daisy Pepman''' is a cheery doctor who works in [[Dermatology|dermatology]].



Cristina went to dermatology to get cerave cream for a patient. Daisy helped her and offered her water with raspberries while she waited for Daisy to get the cream. ''("[[Brave New World]]")''


After finding a mole on her back, Izzie went to dermatology, where Daisy removed it. Daisy wasn't concerned about the mole, even combined with Izzie's abnormal labs, but she sent it to pathology. She later had to deliver the news to Izzie that it was malignant. ''("[[An Honest Mistake]]")''


Dr. Daisy Pepman is a [[Dermatology|dermatologist]], and in her first year of her dermatology [[Resident|residency]].

'''Dan Pollock''' is the father of [[Stacy Pollock]].


Dan and Lisa came to the hospital with their daughter, Stacy, when she had trouble with her heart. They expected that surgery would repair her heart and she'd be okay, but in surgery, the doctors repaired the defect, but her heart was so diseased that Stacy needed a heart-lung transplant and needed constant medication while she waited for it. A missed dose would mean she'd die. When her parents were upset at the idea of her having to stay in a hospital bed, [[Miranda Bailey|Bailey]] proposed an alternative, that she wear a backpack with a bump, which would allow her to live her life normally while she waited for a transplant.



He is married to [[Lisa Pollock]].


He and his wife have a daughter, Stacy. When Stacy was in the hospital to have heart surgery, they were extremely worried.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Pollock, Dan}}

{{Intern and Resident Infobox |image = InternDani.png |name = Dani Mandvi |status = Alive |alias = |title = M.D. |job = [[General Surgery|Surgical]] [[Resident]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]] |first appearance = [[A Change is Gonna Come]] |last appearance = [[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Amrapali Ambegaokar]] }} '''Dani Mandvi''' was originally a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|intern]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] who later became a [[Resident|resident]]. On her first day, she was assigned to [[Cristina Yang]]. Cristina took her on a tour of the hospital and used the same new intern speech that Bailey had used for her class to introduce them to the rules. However, her speech was derailed when her pager didn't go off as she told the interns to move when she moves. At the end of the day, all the new interns were in awe of George, who had delivered a baby that day, on what they all thought was his first ever shift as an intern. ''("[[A Change is Gonna Come]]")'' When Cristina was stabbed by an icicle, Dani and [[Steve Mostow|Steve]] treated her, though she berated them because they didn't know how to read the x-ray. ''("[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]]")'' When [[George O'Malley]] became a resident and the other residents had to choose an intern each to give to him, they lined all the interns up in the cafeteria and discussed their pros and cons right in front of them as they decided. ''("[[There's No 'I' in Team]]")'' Owen stabbed four pigs as part of a skills lab and the interns and residents worked to keep them alive. ''("[[Life During Wartime]]")'' While waiting outside an on-call room trying to get some sleep, Dani, Steve, and Ryan heard a loud, painful moan when Mark broke his penis. Later, while they watched his surgery, they gossiped about who might have broken it. Sadie eventually confessed, despite it actually being Lexie. ''("[[Stairway to Heaven]]")'' Wanting to remind the interns, who were still on probation, why they loved medicine, [[Izzie Stevens]] put together a medical contest for them, which involved diagnosing patients based on symptoms presented to them and draping patients for specific surgeries. ''("[[Before and After]]")'' The interns worked on Patient X (actually Izzie using her own scans and labs) and presented a few ideas to Izzie. After more tests, they decided that Patient X was fine, before Izzie told them she was not fine. At the end of the day, they presented their final diagnosis: metastatic melanoma, with mets to the skin, liver, and brain. Her prognosis was very poor. They asked Izzie what their prize was, but she said the prize is that they didn't screw it up. ''("[[I Will Follow You Into the Dark]]")'' When [[David Young]] came into the hospital for his face transplant, the interns were prepared for his surgery and were told they'd likely never see another one again. ''("[[Stand By Me]]")'' When Izzie went into surgery to have the mets removed from her brain, the interns waited outside the OR. The residents let them because people are better than no people. ''("[[Elevator Love Letter]]")'' She attended Alex and Izzie's wedding. ''("[[What a Difference a Day Makes]]")'' When the merger between [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] and [[Mercy West Medical Center]] was announced, the interns all began working around the clock, because they were scared to go home out of fear that they'd end up getting cut from the program. After the emails for the first round of layoffs went out, Izzie hugged her and Dani didn't have her lab coat on, implying she got cut from the program. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")'' Dani is a surgical intern at Seattle Grace Hospital. Since she was never seen again after the first round of cutbacks, it's likely she was part of the / of her class cut. '''Dave Kristler''' came into the ER after the meth lab he was running exploded.


Dave and his wife were cooking meth when it exploded. Marla and their son, Brian, were injured in the blast and were taken to the ER. Dave was upset because Brian wouldn't stop crying after the explosion. After labs showed that Brian had crystal meth in his system, he had [[Laura]] stay with them so he wouldn't be alone with Brian. [[Callie Torres]] ordered him to call social services to handle the situation, but he confronted Dave when Dave wondered why Brian wouldn't stop crying, saying he couldn't stop crying because the meth had fried his system. Dave punched Alex and took Brian.

He went and hid in his wife's bathroom and Brian had a stroke. Derek found them and took Brian so he could have surgery. Dave was then arrested for cooking meth.



He is married to [[Marla Kristler]]. When he lost his job, they started cooking meth together to make ends meet.


He and his wife have a son, Brian. While they cooked meth, he passively ingested it. After the meth lab exploded, his grandmother came to take him because his parents were arrested.


Marla and Dave are friends with their neighbor, [[Archie Roche]]. He sometimes babysat Brian. When he found out that they had been cooking meth, he was shocked and disappointed.


Dave had lost his job, which is why they started making meth.

'''David''' is one of the boys who dared [[Andrew Langston]] to jump in cement.


[[Kip]], David, and [[Will (Freedom)|Will]] dared [[Andrew Langston]] to lie down in wet cement on a job site. He did it because [[Lola (Freedom)|Lola]] was watching and he wanted to impress her. They then came to the hospital with him, though they continued to make fun of him. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''

They stayed at the hospital and because of their influence, Lola refused to go see Andrew before his surgery. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''



Kip, David, and Will are friends.

'''David Pailey''' is the father of [[Duncan Pailey]].


David came to the hospital when his son, Duncan, was diagnosed with aortic valve disease. Duncan tried to refuse surgery because he was scared and wouldn't cooperate with the doctors along the way, but [[George O'Malley]] ultimately got him to cooperate by showing him how everything worked.



He is married to [[Lauren Pailey]].


He was worried about his son when he needed surgery, because they couldn't find a way to get him to agree to have the surgery.

'''David Young''' was a patient who had a face transplant.


Twelve years ago, David was hit by a drunk driver and lost the majority of his face. He'd had nine surgeries, but none had brought back full form or function. The loss of his face led him to seek out [[Mark Sloan]], as Mark was a world-renowned plastic surgeon, to do a face transplant on him.

David met friends online, therefore they knew nothing of his accident or his face, though he invited them to come and take care of him after he learned that he needed people to care for him after his surgery, otherwise hospital protocol would not allow Mark to perform the transplant. When his friends showed up before his surgery, because they decided to take an earlier flight, he drove them off and yelled at them to get out of his room, turning the injured half of his face away from them. The doctors convinced him to let them come back, mostly because Mark told him that he would not be able to undergo a major surgery such as a facial transplant without people to care for him after he came out of surgery. He explained to his friends that he didn't want them to see him like this, because he thought himself ugly, but one of his friends, [[Shayna]], gently kissed the top of his forehead and said to him, "Do not call my dear friend ugly," establishing that she wanted to be his friend, no matter what he looked like.

His surgery went well and afterward, they were able to get a sneak preview of it. Even though there was swelling, he was pleased with the outcome.



David, [[Shayna]], [[Milo]], and [[Dexter]] all met on a message board for orchid lovers. When David was in the hospital for a face transplant, the others came to be with him. He initially refused to see them because he didn't want them to see his face pre-transplant, but he ultimately let them come in and they didn't see him as ugly.


*He was  at the time of his accident, since he was hit  years ago.
*He was  at the time of his transplant.
*He had nine reconstructive surgeries.

{{Nurse Infobox |image = NurseDebbie.png |name = Debbie |born = June |status = Alive |alias = *Deb *DebbieDoesGossip |siblings = Val |other family = *Pete \u ''(uncle)'' *Lucy ''(aunt)'' *Sam ''(nephew)'' *Betty ''(cousin)'' *Byrd ''(great-grandmother)'' *Cousins |job = Nurse |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]]
'''Former'''
County Hospital |first appearance = [[Something to Talk About]] |last appearance = [[What Have I Done to Deserve This?]] |count = |seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] |portrayed by = [[Cathy Lind Hayes]] }} '''Debbie''' was a nurse at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. During Debbie's high school prom, she wore a daffodil yellow dress. Her date came out as gay and left her for the DJ, which Debbie was fine with, except that they took the limo and left her stranded at the high school. She had to call a cab to get home. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' At the beginning of Miranda Bailey's internship, she met Debbie, who taught Bailey about manners, and respect, not just for patients, but for her superiors and her fellow interns as well. Debbie also warned her not to "piss off the nurses", and warned her of the consequences if she did. While Bailey and Debbie were working together on a patient that was about to have open-heart surgery, Bailey became increasingly cranky. She ordered Debbie to get her some coffee, telling her "Go and get it done". She got Bailey her coffee, but Debbie got her revenge and Bailey didn't see the inside of the OR for an entire month. ''("[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]]")'' For Richard's th birthday, Debbie threw a surprise party for him down at the cafeteria. She bought a chocolate cake, streamers, party hats, and even booked a DJ. ''("[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]]")'' Before her internship, Meredith gave herself a tour around the hospital. She began to stare at the interns, thinking that would be her soon. Debbie found her and told her that she would even drink with them every night at the Emerald City Bar. Debbie proceeded to tell Meredith a few funny intern stories, as well as everything to know about the Emerald City Bar. She told Meredith to not worry about all the stress and said to her "You'll always have the Emerald City Bar". ''("[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]]")'' When [[R. Hubble|Mr. Hubble]] was admitted to the hospital for swallowing heads of Judy Dolls, Alex bought a bunch of them and began to take the heads off of them for a joke. When Debbie opened the door and saw the Judy Dolls, she began to laugh at Alex since he was struggling with getting the heads off of the dolls. She left for a few minutes and came back, sat down, and grabbed a doll, holding its legs, instructing Alex to pull as hard as he could on the head. They succeeded with the first one and did many more. ''("[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]]")'' After Debbie brought in leftover paella, Burke asked her about how she made it. She used a slightly different recipe, which included cinnamon. After he criticized her recipe, she challenged him to a paella-making contest, which Burke accepted. They brought in their paella dishes the next day and set up a blind taste test, which included [[BokHee]], [[George O'Malley]], [[Izzie Stevens]], [[Miranda Bailey]], and [[Richard Webber]]. Bailey and Richard choose Burke's, while BokHee and Izzie chose Debbie's. It was down to George, whom Burke thought would choose his, but George chose Debbie's dish instead, which made hers the winning dish. ''("[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]]")'' When the new interns arrived at Seattle Grace, Debbie and the other nurses were betting on who would be the next "[[]]". Debbie bet on [[Izzie Stevens|Izzie]], since she heard that she used to be a lingerie model. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' When a rape victim, [[Allison]], was admitted to Seattle Grace, Debbie said she never seen the staff rally around a patient like they did with her. She saw the surgery where Burke pulled out the rapist's penis out of Allison's esophagus. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' She attended the [[Izzie's Meet-the-Boyfriend Get Together|party]] Izzie threw for her boyfriend. At the party, she made out with her ex-boyfriend, [[Dr. Taylor]]. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' When Joe was admitted to the hospital because of his aneurysm, Debbie stayed at the hospital with him, despite her shift ending three hours before. She bought him muffins and passed around a get-well card for all the staff to sign for Joe. She was relieved to find out that his surgery went well and he was recovering. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' When [[Cristina Yang]] annoyed her by dismissing her rudely when she asked about [[Shane Herman]], Debbie got revenge by paging her constantly for disgusting cases. At the end of the day, Yang went to Bailey and asked why she was paged for all those cases, but Bailey said she didn't know what she was talking about. Debbie then told Cristina that if she had've shown a bit of respect, she could've saved herself a very long day. ''("[[Something to Talk About]]")'' When Sophie Larson was hospitalized, Debbie was one of her nurses. When George inquired about why Sophie hadn't yet left the hospital, Debbie said it's because she's not a bouncer. She complained about the lack of resources and staffing in the hospital. ''("[[Tell Me Sweet Little Lies]]")'' While driving home from work, she suddenly veered off the road and into a ditch. Debbie realized that she had fallen asleep at the wheel, due to her exhaustion from the nurses being understaffed. Debbie then said that from that incident she knew it was time to take a stand. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' When the understaffing pushed them to the breaking point, the second-shift nurses did a sick out and Debbie delivered official notice to Richard that they were going on strike in ten days. ''("[[Tell Me Sweet Little Lies]]")'' At :, the last minute of her last shift pre-strike, she locked herself in the bathroom stall, allowed herself to hyperventilate for seconds, and then went into the OR and gave Richard the final notice about the strike. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' While walking the picket line, Debbie, along with Olivia and Tyler, asked George to go in to check on their patients. ''("[[Break on Through]]")'' During her lunch break, Cristina pelted the nurses with half a dozen tuna sandwiches. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' Later that evening, at Joe's bar, the nurses retaliated by pouring a drink on Cristina's lap. She then began to fight with the nurses, calling one of them a soccer mom, but Meredith diffused it and dragged Cristina out of the bar. ''("[[Break on Through]]")'' When there was a bomb in [[James Carlson|a patient's]] chest cavity, Debbie informed the Chief when the Bomb Squad arrived to help after a bomb threat. ''("[[It's the End of the World]]")'' She also later provided the hospital blueprints, which showed that the bomb was directly over the hospital's main oxygen line. ''("[[As We Know It]]")'' While Debbie was walking through the tunnels, she was cornered by [[Callie Torres]], who asked her who George's friends were, where he lived, whether or not Debbie had worked with him much, how he was with patients and doctors, his pet peeves, and if he had a girlfriend. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' When [[Shawn Beglight]] came into the hospital with a head injury, Debbie was one of his nurses. She assisted the doctors when they had to drill a burr hole in his hospital room and then [[Rick Beglight|Rick]], Shawn's father, threw up on her. ''("[[What Have I Done to Deserve This?]]")'' [[Steve Mostow]] Debbie considered pursuing a romantic relationship with [[Steve Mostow|Steve]] after he passed out in her car the week before Halloween. On the night of Halloween, they met up at [[Emerald City Bar|Joe's bar]]. [[Dr. Taylor]] She dated [[Dr. Taylor]] for a time. They bonded over doing crosswords together in the OR and he eventually used a crossword joke to ask her out on a date. Things broke off between them because she didn't like that he didn't like to do anything that didn't involve alcohol. After they split, she kept being drawn to him, even though she knew it was a bad idea. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' On Thanksgiving Day, her uncle Pete passed away. He was a nurse and was an activist for Equal Male Nursing Opportunities. Debbie says that he was a man ahead of his time. Her aunt Lucy, who was also a nurse, made rice krispie stuffing and says that Pete ate too much of it. In addition to Pete and Lucy being nurses, Debbie's sister Val, all her cousins, and her great-grandmother, Byrd were all nurses as well. Debbie said that her cousin Betty had a good sense of humor but had low self-esteem. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' Her clique is [[Tyler Christian|Tyler]], [[Olivia Jankovic|Olivia]], and Liz. She and Joe are best friends. They met at the bar, and Debbie recalls that he was pouring her tequila, but they knew they would be friends on the day of the first annual Emerald City Darts Tournament. When it was time to play, Joe needed a partner after his flaked on him, and Debbie volunteered to be his partner. Her dart skills brought her and Joe up to semifinals, where they lost. Joe congratulated Debbie on her dart skills and she thanked him for taking her mind off work. While munching on peanuts, they began to gossip about the people they both knew. Debbie then had the revelation that they shared a connection to almost every person at Seattle Grace; Debbie saw them at work, and Joe saw them after work. Debbie said that it was like "comparing notes". They have been best friends ever since. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' [[Elizabeth Fallon]] She was good friends with Elizabeth while she worked at the hospital. When she died, Debbie was in the room and she said it was a strangely serene moment. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' [[Yvonne]] Yvonne and Debbie hit it off while [[Mary]] was being treated. Debbie even managed to get them some jello cups, despite the cafeteria being closed. When Yvonne died due to internal bleeding, Debbie said that it hit her hard since she looked fine but was more damaged then most of the patients in the room. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' [[Cristina Yang]] After Cristina stole a patient from the psych ward and dismissed Debbie rudely after asking for paperwork on the patient, she paged her constantly for rectal exams and other disgusting cases. At the end of the day, Cristina went to Bailey, assuming that it was her, and asked why she was paged for all those cases, but Bailey said that she had no idea what she was talking about. Debbie then says to Cristina that if she had shown a little respect, she could've saved herself a ''very long day''. During the nurses' strike, she pelted the nurses with half a dozen tuna sandwiches. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' At Joe's bar, the nurses retaliated by pouring a drink on Cristina's lap. She then began to get into a fight with the nurses, calling one a soccer mom, but [[Meredith Grey|Meredith]] dragged Cristina out of the bar before it could happen. ''("[[Break on Through]])'' [[George O'Malley]] After he refused to cross the picket line, Debbie said that she had a newfound respect for George. Debbie and a few other nurses sent George into the hospital so that they could receive reports on their patients. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' [[Richard Webber]] She has a good professional relationship with Richard. He says she is like family and also says that while Adele keeps him in check at home, Debbie is the one that keeps him in line at work. She informs Adele of what he is doing at the hospital and calls her if Richard is stuck in surgery and won't make it home for dinner. Debbie also reminds him about birthdays, holidays, and wedding anniversaries. For his th birthday, Debbie threw a surprise party at the hospital and Richard says he will never forget it. ''("[[Overheard at the Emerald City Bar]]")'' When she started at Seattle Grace, she was intimidated by [[Ellis Grey]] and says she was the Cristina Yang of her class. Debbie says that Ellis is still is one of the most skilled doctors she ever worked with. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' She worked at Seattle Grace as a nurse from the time of Ellis Grey and remained until at least [[Meredith Grey|Meredith Grey's]] second year of residency. She was a large part of the nurses' strike when the hospital was understaffed. ''("[[Break on Through]]")'' Before working at Seattle Grace, she worked at County Hospital. ''("[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]]")'' *She has an [http://www.seattlegracegossip.com official blog]. *She loves to gossip.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] *She's a stickler for paperwork.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] *She likes to sing.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] *She cooks.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] *She's a Gemini.[[Notes from the Nurses' Station]] *She '''Deborah Fleiss''' was shot when [[Petey]] started firing on a restaurant.


Deborah and her fianc\ue, [[Neal Hannigan|Neal]], were paying at the register at a restaurant when [[Petey]] came in and started shooting. Deborah was shot and the bullet went through her arm and grazed Neal, who had ducked behind her when he heard gunshots.

Their wounds were irrigated and they were sent to x-ray to find the bullets.



She was engaged to [[Neal Hannigan]]. They had already sent out invitations to their wedding, which was six weeks away. She broke it off when he ducked behind her during a shooting. After a day in the hospital together, she decided to give him another chance only to break it off again when he ducked behind her a second time.

'''Dennison "Denny" Duquette, Sr.''' is the father of Izzie Stevens'\uafianc\ue, [[Denny Duquette, Jr.]].


After Denny's death, he visited [[Izzie Stevens]] to find out the full story of how his son died and how he managed to propose to a woman like Izzie on the day that he died. He accused her of wanting him for his money. After she explained, he gave her an envelope which held a check for $,,.



Denny Duquette, Sr. married and had one son who was named after himself.


When his son was diagnosed, he and his wife were devastated. One day, Denny disappeared, leaving a note that he didn't want them to have to watch him die. They assumed he was dead until he left them a voicemail saying he'd gotten a new heart and was engaged. ''("[[What I Am]]")''


*According to him, Denny's type was smart, dark-haired girls.
