'''Karen''' was in the hospital to receive a liver transplant from her sister, Marcy.


Karen was in liver failure. Her sister, Marcy, was a match and agreed to donate part of her liver to her sister. While they were hospitalized, Marcy pestered Karen by constantly talking about this wonderful thing she was doing for Karen and how she was missing her family vacation to do it.

Karen told Marcy that she knew that Marcy would hold the liver donation over her head for the rest of their lives. They fought over it and Karen said that she didn't want Marcy's liver anymore. However, Karen began to cough up blood, a sign of end-stage liver failure. Karen agreed to accept Marcy's liver.

After the surgery, Karen and Marcy started to fight again. Karen said that Marcy was never allowed to mention the liver again or she would reveal some of Marcy's secrets. When they continued to fight even after that, Meredith silenced both of them, saying they were in time out.



Karen received a liver transplant from her sister, Marcy. While they were hospitalized, they bickered constantly. Marcy constantly reminded Karen of what a good thing she was doing for her, much to Karen's annoyance.


*Her liver transplant was [[Richard Webber|Richard's]] ,th surgery.

'''Kelley Hanson''' is a patient who came into the clinic to learn how to use tampons and pads. Bailey then called her the eight million dollar patient.


Kelley came into the clinic with her father, who was raising her by himself after her mother's death. When she got her period, he brought her to the clinic to learn how to use pads and tampons. Kelley sat through the explanation, but as soon as her father was out of the room, she confessed that she'd had sex and wondered if she could be pregnant because it happened before she'd gotten her period. [[Miranda Bailey]] talked to her and ran a pregnancy test and STD panel. All the results came back negative, but Bailey warned her that she needed to change her behavior or she would end up pregnant or with an STD.



Kelley had sex with a guy and afterward, he started ignoring her at school and acting like a jerk.


Kelley's mother died when she was young and she was being raised by her single father.

'''Kelly''' was the wife of a man killed in an car accident. She donated some of his organs to [[Jackson Prescott]].


Kelly was brought into [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] where her husband, Matthew, was declared brain dead. She had to unplug him, but at the same time, [[Jackson Prescott]] was dying. [[George O'Malley|George]] discovered the patient and [[Richard Webber|Richard]] spoke with her and even though the man wasn't a donor, he pleaded with her to donate his organs.

At first, she refused, but after he spoke with her again, telling her that he couldn't take his organs to heaven and that they would be uselesss, she complied.



Kelly was married, but her husband, Matthew, was declared brain dead after a car accident. He would hold Kelly's hands when she got scared.

'''Kendall Sully''' is a patient who had a hernia repaired by [[Cristina Yang]].


Kendall was in the hospital with a hernia. She had numerous questions, but Cristina was busy trying to get [[Izzie Stevens|Izzie]] in to see [[Rebecca Swender]], so she wasn't able to answer most of them. Right before her surgery, Kendall asked Cristina to tell her she was going to be okay, even though she thought it was only a silly little surgery for her. Cristina insisted that it wasn't just a silly surgery for her and said she'd be okay, which reassured her.



She wondered if she'd be able to hold her grandkids after her surgery.


Her friends went on a European trip while she was in the hospital. They weren't going to go when her hernia became a problem, but she insisted that they go. One of her friends, Bill Ferguson, is a retired surgeon and helped her with some questions to ask before her surgery.


*She wears glasses and frequently loses them.

'''Kendra Thomas''' is a pregnant woman who was shot when [[Petey]] opened fire on the restaurant where she works.


Kendra was working at a restaurant when she was shot in the head. She was taken for a CT. [[George O'Malley|George]] informed [[Derek Shepherd|Derek]] that she was also pregnant. Her fetus was  weeks and healthy.

Derek took Kendra into surgery. He tried helping her, but she was pronounced brain dead. Her parents were told about her condition and they asked about the baby. They wanted to know if they could keep Kendra on life support in order to keep the baby alive long enough for her to deliver.

Addison advised the parents that it was a very bad decision, as there were multiple ways it could go wrong, but they were not convinced.

George later spoke to them and said that from what he had heard about Kendra, she would want to save other lives by letting her organs be donated. He asked them to consider that. They decided to donate her organs.



Kendra's parents came to the hospital when she was injured in the shooting. They wanted to keep her alive in order to allow the pregnancy to continue, but after being reminded that Kendra liked to help people, they agreed to have life support turned off so her organs could be donated.


Kendra is well-liked by her co-workers.


Kendra worked at a restaurant as a waitress until her death. She was said to be good with the customers.


*She was  when she died.
*She was described by [[Will ( Seconds)|Will]] as very nice, covering shifts when needed and standing up to [[Brad Ackles]].

They stayed at the hospital and because of their influence, Lola refused to go see Andrew before his surgery. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''

'''Kurt Walling''' was one of the participants in the domino kidney transplant. He received a kidney from [[Lindsay Herman]].


Kurt Walling was in chronic renal failure secondary to diabetes which required dialysis four times a week. In order to get a kidney transplant, he offered his son, [[P.J. Walling|P.J.]], $, to join a domino kidney transplant. P.J. donated a kidney to [[Stan Mercer]] and Kurt received one from [[Lindsay Herman]].

The transplant went well, but Kurt had a seizure and delayed graft function post-op.



His relationship with his son, [[P.J. Walling]], is strained. His mother died and his father worked all the time. When Kurt needed a kidney transplant, it took him months to find his son because they hadn't spoken in over a year. When Kurt wasn't doing well post-op, P.J. was warned that this might be his last change to get to know his father.


*He was  at the time of his kidney transplant.

'''Larry Maxwell''' is [[Chief of Surgery]] at [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]].


When Bailey came into the ER at Seattle Pres claiming to be having a heart attack, Maxwell sent his intern, [[Intern Stuart|Stuart]], to run tests on her. When the initial tests revealed nothing of concern, she insisted on being seen by someone higher-up, so Maxwell came to see her himself. He also didn't believed there was anything wrong with her, so he refused to run a cardiac stress test. Instead, he sent a psychiatrist to consult with her. Later, after helping save another patient in the ER, [[Morgan]], Bailey collapsed. He placed a stent, but it failed, so [[Maggie Pierce|Maggie]] stepped in to do a keyhole CABG to repair the damage.



He and [[Richard Webber]] have known each other for years and play golf together.


He is the [[Chief of Surgery]] and an [[attending]] [[Cardiothoracic Surgery|cardiothoracic surgeon]] at [[Seattle Presbyterian Hospital]].


*He went to Yale Medical School.

'''Laura''' is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



Laura came with a group of new interns to see the intern locker room. When they saw George cleaning out his locker, they went to check out the cafeteria. ''("[[Didn't We Almost Have It All?]]")''


On her first day as an intern, she was assigned to [[Alex Karev]], who took them on a tour of the hospital and used the same new intern speech that Bailey had used for her class to introduce them to the rules.

At the end of the day, all the new interns were in awe of George, who had delivered a baby that day, on what they all thought was his first ever shift as an intern. ''("[[A Change is Gonna Come]]")''


Alex was examining [[Brian Kristler]] in the ER when he noticed that he smelled like meth. Laura brought Alex Brian's films, which showed no acute injury, so Alex told Laura to run a tox screen, which showed meth use. He had her stay with [[Dave Kristler]], telling her not to leave him alone with the baby. ''("[[Love/Addiction]]")''


When [[George O'Malley]] became a resident and the other residents had to choose an intern each to give to him, they lined all the interns up in the cafeteria and discussed their pros and cons right in front of them as they decided. ''("[[There's No 'I' in Team]]")''


Owen stabbed four pigs as part of a skills lab and the interns and residents worked to keep them alive. ''("[[Life During Wartime]]")''


Wanting to remind the interns, who were still on probation, why they loved medicine, [[Izzie Stevens]] put together a medical contest for them, which involved diagnosing patients based on symptoms presented to them and draping patients for specific surgeries. ''("[[Before and After]]")''


The interns worked on Patient X (actually Izzie using her own scans and labs) and presented a few ideas to Izzie. After more tests, they decided that Patient X was fine, before Izzie told them she was not fine. At the end of the day, they presented their final diagnosis: metastatic melanoma, with mets to the skin, liver, and brain. Her prognosis was very poor. They asked Izzie what their prize was, but she said the prize is that they didn't screw it up. ''("[[I Will Follow You Into the Dark]]")''


When [[David Young]] came into the hospital for his face transplant, the interns were prepared for his surgery and were told they'd likely never see another one again. Laura got in trouble with Izzie for making fun of the patient. ''("[[Stand By Me]]")''


When Izzie went into surgery to have the mets removed from her brain, the interns waited outside the OR. The residents let them because people are better than no people. ''("[[Elevator Love Letter]]")''


She attended Alex and Izzie's wedding. ''("[[What a Difference a Day Makes]]")''


When the merger between [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] and [[Mercy West Medical Center]] was announced, the interns all began working around the clock, because they were scared to go home out of fear that they'd end up getting cut from the program. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")''


Laura was originally assigned as one of [[Alex Karev|Dr. Alex Karev's]] [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Internship|interns]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. She then became a surgical [[Resident|resident]]. Since she was never seen after the first round of cutbacks, it's likely she was part of the / of her class that was cut. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")''

She was worried about her son when he needed surgery, because she couldn't find a way to get him to agree to have the surgery.

|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]
|portrayed by = [[Romy Rosemont]]
}}
'''Lea Seibert''' came into the ER after being in a car accident that her husband caused.


Lea, her husband, Bob, and her son, Scott, were in a car accident. A car had cut her Bob off and he, in a rage, caused an accident. The driver of the other car involved died and Bob was left in critical condition. Lea and Scott had only minor injuries and had to be monitored, but Bob was seriously injured and had to be taken into surgery. Even before the accident, he was in liver failure and his condition was worsened by the car accident. While the doctors were operating, they asked about a potential donor. Scott had been tested as a match, but hadn't agreed to be a donor. Lea pressured her son to donate, as they were informed that Bob wouldn't survive the surgery without a transplant. After speaking with [[Alex Karev|Alex]] about his own experience, Scottie agreed to donate, but only on the condition that he and his mom moved out of the house and she told the police everything her husband had been doing to her.



She is married to [[Bob Seibert]]. He is an alcoholic who beats her. She had multiple healed injuries revealed when she was in a car accident. As part of the agreement to get her son to donate a portion of his liver to save his life, she had to leave him and tell the police what he'd been doing to her.


She has one son, Scott. When her husband needed a liver transplant, Scottie started counseling to talk to him about donating a portion of his. He agreed to donate only if his mom agreed to leave his dad.


*She was  at the time of the car accident.
*In the original script, her first name was Lin.

'''Leah Epstein''' is the daughter of [[Tim Epstein]].


While stringing up Hannamus (Hanukkah/Christmas) lights at his house, Leah's father, Tim, fell  feet and hit his head. He had weakness in his left side, so they ordered a CT. Despite the fact that noise made his head hurt, Tim insisted that his kids stay in the room because he didn't want to miss out on the holidays with them.

The CT revealed a subdural hematoma. He needed surgery, but was warned that the bleed was in the area that controls speech and motor function. He had the surgery and it went well, but afterward, he was irritable and had an angry outburst at his kids and sent them out of the room.

Izzie suspected that Derek's disparaging remarks during Tim's surgery, but he said there was probably something that the first CT missed. He ordered Izzie to monitor Tim for a few hours and if it didn't improve, to order a new CT.

The new CT showed a second bleed in his frontal lobe that had had a delayed presentation. They prepped him for a second surgery. He was still angry and irritable, which concerned his wife. In his second surgery, wondering if it might help, Derek had the nurses play carols.

Tim woke up from his second surgery smiling.



The Epstein family is very close and takes the holidays very seriously. They have elaborate celebrations of both Hanukkah and Christmas. When Tim's personality changed after he had brain surgery, his family was very concerned as he wasn't anything like the happy, loving man they'd known before.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Epstein, Leah}}

|name = Leo Byrider
|status = Alive

|last appearance = [[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]
|count = 
|seasons = '''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season  (Grey's Anatomy)|]]

}}
'''Leo Byrider''' is a surgical resident at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



On his first day of internship, he was assigned to [[Izzie Stevens]], who took the group on a tour of the hospital and used the same new intern speech that Bailey had used for her class to introduce them to the rules. Her interns viewed her as the dud, having heard that she'd spent some time on probation after killing someone.

After they spent the day saving a deer with Izzie, she said that they were the dud interns.

At the end of the day, all the new interns were in awe of George, who had delivered a baby that day, on what they all thought was his first ever shift as an intern. ''("[[A Change is Gonna Come]]")''


When the rumor spread that Callie and Izzie were going to fight in the hospital cafeteria, the interns, along with several other hospital staffers, gathered to watch it happen. However, Callie hadn't intended to fight and the interns were disappointed, calling it a forfeit on Callie's part. ''("[[The Heart of the Matter]]")''


Claire, Graciella, Leo, and Mitch all attended a housewarming party thrown by George and Lexie. They all ended up coming to work drunk the next day. ''("[[Piece of My Heart]]")''


The night after the party, the interns planned a darts tournament. When George invited Izzie, they started considering dropping out because they didn't want to play darts with their boss. ''("[[Piece of My Heart]]")''


When [[George O'Malley]] became a resident and the other residents had to choose an intern each to give to him, they lined all the interns up in the cafeteria and discussed their pros and cons right in front of them as they decided. ''("[[There's No 'I' in Team]]")''


Owen stabbed four pigs as part of a skills lab and the interns and residents worked to keep them alive. ''("[[Life During Wartime]]")''


The interns continued to practice and were joined by [[Sadie Harris]]. Cristina became suspicious when Lexie knew the parallel pulley stitch, something she hadn't taught her, which led to her discovering what they were doing. She told them to shut it down. ''("[[These Ties That Bind]]")''

The interns then gave Steve an epidural to practice. ''("[[In the Midnight Hour]]")''


The interns wanted to remove Steve's appendix while he was on the epidural, but he refused, so Sadie volunteered as long as she could remove one of theirs when they were done. They numbed her and Lexie used a book to guide her as she prepared to operate. When she hesitated, Sadie took the scalpel and made the first cut herself. When Lexie got to the appendix, it was inflamed, meaning this wasn't a routine procedure. Graciella said they should call a resident and then decided to leave when they wouldn't do it. Cristina then figured out that they hadn't shut it down like she told them to. Lexie came to Meredith because Sadie became unstable. Meredith and Cristina took over the surgery. They sent for Bailey and managed to save Sadie's life. The interns were then called in to present her case, admitting that they made choices that compromised her care. They were all then placed on probation until further notice. ''("[[In the Midnight Hour]]")''


Leo, Sadie, and Megan all had to work with Izzie in the clinic for a day. When they did procedures on patients, she also had them perform them on her. ''("[[Beat Your Heart Out]]")''


Wanting to remind the interns, who were still on probation, why they loved medicine, [[Izzie Stevens]] put together a medical contest for them, which involved diagnosing patients based on symptoms presented to them and draping patients for specific surgeries. ''("[[Before and After]]")''


The interns worked on Patient X (actually Izzie using her own scans and labs) and presented a few ideas to Izzie. After more tests, they decided that Patient X was fine, before Izzie told them she was not fine. At the end of the day, they presented their final diagnosis: metastatic melanoma, with mets to the skin, liver, and brain. Her prognosis was very poor. They asked Izzie what their prize was, but she said the prize is that they didn't screw it up. ''("[[I Will Follow You Into the Dark]]")''


When [[David Young]] came into the hospital for his face transplant, the interns were prepared for his surgery and were told they'd likely never see another one again. Leo got in trouble for making fun of the patient. ''("[[Stand By Me]]")''


When Izzie went into surgery to have the mets removed from her brain, the interns waited outside the OR. The residents let them because people are better than no people. ''("[[Elevator Love Letter]]")''


He attended Alex and Izzie's wedding. ''("[[What a Difference a Day Makes]]")''


When George died, Leo attended the funeral. ''("[[Good Mourning]]")''


When the merger between [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] and [[Mercy West Medical Center]] was announced, the interns all began working around the clock, because they were scared to go home out of fear that they'd end up getting cut from the program.

Cristina had Pierce, Megan, and Leo spy on the Chief for her and report back what they saw. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")''


Leo was one of [[Izzie Stevens]]' interns. Since he was never seen again after the first round of cutbacks, it's likely he was part of the / of his class cut. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")''

'''Lily''' is the daughter of [[June Crowley]].


Lily and the rest of her family came to the hospital when her mother, June, was finally receiving a liver transplant after three years on the waiting list. When June was presented with the chance to decline the liver that had been allocated to her in order to save the life of a patient whose liver failure was more immediately life-threatening, the whole family was shocked when she said no. The transplant went forward as planned and June's family was told it went well.



When her mother needed a liver transplant, Lily and the rest of the family came to the hospital to support her.

'''Lindsay Herman''' was one of the participants in the domino kidney transplant. She donated her kidney to [[Kurt Walling]].


Lindsay was having an affair with [[Stan Mercer]], who needed a kidney transplant. She joined a domino kidney exchange in order to get him one, though she pretended that she was donating altruistically. After several people praised her, including Stan's wife, [[Nancy Mercer|Nancy]], she decided she couldn't take it anymore and came clean.

The transplants went on, despite the revelation. Stan's transplant went well, but afterward, he didn't call or ask about Lindsay. She was devastated that he hadn't chosen her.



She was having an affair with Stan Mercer. They'd been dating for three years. She agreed to donate a kidney for him, hoping it would force him to choose between her and his wife. After the kidney transplants, he didn't call or ask about her and she realized he hadn't chosen her.


She works with [[Stan Mercer]].

'''Lisa Pollock''' is the mother of [[Stacy Pollock]].


Lisa and Dan came to the hospital with their daughter, Stacy, when she had trouble with her heart. They expected that surgery would repair her heart and she'd be okay, but in surgery, the doctors repaired the defect, but her heart was so diseased that Stacy needed a heart-lung transplant and needed constant medication while she waited for it. A missed dose would mean she'd die. When her parents were upset at the idea of her having to stay in a hospital bed, [[Miranda Bailey|Bailey]] proposed an alternative, that she wear a backpack with a bump, which would allow her to live her life normally while she waited for a transplant.



She is married to [[Dan Pollock]].


She and her husband have a daughter, Stacy. When Stacy was in the hospital to have heart surgery, they were extremely worried.

'''Lola''' is a friend of [[Andrew Langston]].


Lola came into the hospital with [[Andrew Langston]], who had tried to impress her by lying down in cement. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''

Andrew asked for Lola, so Callie went to get her. She refused to come because she was worried about what [[Kip]], [[David (Freedom)|David]], and [[Will (Freedom)|Will]] would think. Callie told her that this matters and they don't. And she told Lola that if Andrew died, she would hate herself and she'd be right. Lola later reconsidered and sat by Andrew's bedside after his surgery. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''



She liked [[Andrew Langston]], but didn't act on the feelings because she was worried about what her friends would think. Despite this, after his surgery, she went to sit by his bedside and kissed him.


She was friends with Kip, David, and Will. They often picked on Andrew.

'''Lorraine''' is a patient who was incorrectly informed that she had cancer after her lab results were switched with [[Izzie Stevens|Izzie's]].



Lorraine came into the clinic. While she was trying to draw blood for tests, [[Sadie Harris|Sadie]] poked Lorraine several times. Izzie ultimately let Sadie do a draw on her to show her how before trying again with Lorraine. Lorraine's lab results then showed signs of cancer, so they got her an oncology consult. ''("[[Beat Your Heart Out]]")''


A few days later, Lorraine came back to the hospital, having been sent to several other doctors. She'd had $, worth of medical tests and after all that, it turned out she didn't have cancer. She was only anemic. Her lawyer believed that someone at the clinic had switched her blood sample with someone else's. He told her not to go back, but her conscience wanted to make sure Izzie found out who actually had cancer. ''("[[An Honest Mistake]]")''

'''Lou Bradley''' is the husband of [[Verna Bradley]].


While walking her dog in the rain, Lou's wife, Verna, passed out. She was taken to the hospital, where she had signs of a heart attack. Because she'd had those symptoms before, she wasn't worried about them. Her tests revealed that she hadn't had a heart attack, so Izzie looked for other causes of her pain.

Izzie pulled her records and found that she'd been admitted to the hospital with chest pain every day for the past seven years. She asked about what happened the first year. Lou remembered that it was the day their neighbor, Ted, had died. They watched the funeral home take him away and she had her first episode. Izzie figured out that Verna had been in love with Ted and had stress-induced cardiomyopathy. She was having chest pains because she was grieving for Ted.



He is married to [[Verna Bradley]].

'''Louise O'Malley''' is the mother of [[George O'Malley]].



When the teachers went on strike in , Louise walked the line for  days. ''("[[Break on Through]]")''


When Harold fell and broke his clavicle, she was on a trip to DC with a class. ''("[[Staring at the Sun]]")''


When Harold was diagnosed with cancer, Louise came to his bedside. Together, they decided that despite George wanting Erica to do his surgery that they would have Burke operate on Harold's heart to replace his valve. ''("[[Staring at the Sun]]")''

Before Harold's cancer surgery, Louise invited the extended family to the hospital for a party, figuring Harold wouldn't be up for visitors afterward. After his surgery, she sat by his bedside along with her sons. ''("[[Six Days, Part ]]")''


When Harold's organs started shutting down, his family was informed that he would not be able to wake up and they were given the choice to let nature take its course or turn off life support. They chose to turn off life support and stayed with him while he died. ''("[[Six Days, Part ]]")''


Louise came to the hospital to visit and found Callie. She hadn't been told that Callie and George were getting divorced and she had made baby clothes. When Izzie told her that they weren't together anymore, she was upset. She confronted George and tried to get him to work things out with Callie, but he said it was too late for them. ''("[[Lay Your Hands on Me]]")''


After George was declared brain dead, she asked Callie to decide what to do with his organs as in God's eyes she was still George's wife and because she has too much to do including having to tell [[Ronny O'Malley|Ronny]] and [[Jerry O'Malley|Jerry]], who were on a fishing trip and unreachable. Callie accepted, but passed the duty onto Izzie, whom she felt was the person closest to George. Louise sobbed at George's funeral as he was laid to rest. She later came to Owen, looking for an explanation as to why George had joined the Army. Owen explained how he had tremendous potential as a trauma surgeon. And he wanted to get better faster and save more people. ''("[[Good Mourning]]")''


Louise was admitted into Seattle Grace Mercy West after she had her gallbladder removed at another hospital. Bailey assigned Meredith to take special care of her due to the O'Malley history of dying at Seattle Grace. Her surgery was successful. ''("[[Heart-Shaped Box]]")''


Callie was surprised to see Louise at the hospital. She initially introduced [[Arizona Robbins|Arizona]] as Dr. Robbins. Louise noticed her ring and asked Meredith, who just told her that Callie was re-married and she was happy. Callie waited by Louise's bedside after her surgery. When she woke up, Callie told her that Arizona was her wife and they had a baby. Louise was excited about that and asked to see pictures of [[Sofia Robbin Sloan Torres|Sofia]]. ''("[[Heart-Shaped Box]]")''



Louise was married to her husband, Harold, for  years before his death.


Louise and Harold had three children: Ronny, Jerry, and George.


Louise is a teacher. She went on strike with the teachers' union in . ''("[[Break on Through]]")''

When her [[Harold O'Malley|husband]] was admitted to [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] after collapsing and fracturing his clavicle, she was unable to be with him immediately because she was on a field trip to Washington with her class.


*She is Catholic.
*She likes to knit.
*Although George and Callie divorced a long time ago, she still saw\ua[[Callie Torres|Callie]]\uaas a daughter.
*Her house smells like peppermint.<ref>[[Sympathy for the Devil]], x</ref>
*She walked the teachers' union strike line for  days.<ref>[[Break on Through]], x</ref>

'''Lucy''' is a surgical intern at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].



On the first day of her internship, she was assigned to [[Meredith Grey]], who took them on a tour of the hospital and used the same new intern speech that Bailey had used for her class to introduce them to the rules, though she went on a tangent in the on-call room, telling them not to sleep with anyone else, especially not attendings.

At the end of the day, all the new interns were in awe of George, who had delivered a baby that day, on what they all thought was his first ever shift as an intern. ''("[[A Change is Gonna Come]]")''


When the rumor spread that Callie and Izzie were going to fight in the hospital cafeteria, the interns, along with several other hospital staffers, gathered to watch it happen. However, Callie hadn't intended to fight and the interns were disappointed, calling it a forfeit on Callie's part. ''("[[The Heart of the Matter]]")''


Lucy and Meredith's other interns worked on Meredith and Derek's tumor trial. ''("[[Piece of My Heart]]")''

They later had to organize and collate trial patients. Meredith threatened them with scut if they missed a paper. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")''


Lucy is a surgical intern at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. She is one of Meredith's interns.

'''Madeleine Skurski''' was a patient of [[Meredith Grey]] who was found to have terminal cancer.



Madeleine was hospitalized after a supposed stomach flu turned into severe pain, rendering her unable to move. Meredith suspected gallstones and took her into surgery. However, once inside, she and Bailey noticed that the gallbladder had calcified, which is a sign of cancer. Inspection of the surrounding organs revealed that the cancer had spread to the liver and had encased the hepatic artery, meaning that it could not be removed and was incurable.



She is very close to her students. Upon finding out her cancer was terminal, her primary concern was how she would tell her students. When her class came to visit her, she decided to make it easier by having a disucssion on how they could make it easier to work with their substitute Mr. Arnold who in all likelihood would be taking over as their permanent teacher.


She is a math and science teacher. She had never missed a day until what she believed was a stomach flu, but turned out to be cancer.


*While she was at home, she started watching cooking shows. In the hospital, she watched American Bake-Off.
*[[Emma (Idle Hands)|Emma]], [[Lucas]], and [[Adam]] are three of her students.
*She was  at the time of her hospitalization, shown on the ER Tracking Screen.

'''Marcus King''' is an old classmate of [[Miranda Bailey]] who came into the hospital after being in a bus crash.



He went to the same high school as [[Miranda Bailey]]. While they were there, she had a crush on him and he used this to get her to do all his homework for him. At one point, he implied that he'd take her to Homecoming, but didn't end up inviting her.


Marcus was taking a group of high schoolers on a tour of colleges when the bus they were in slid down an embankment. He was taken to the ER, where his only complaint was cuts on his arm. Bailey stitched up his arm, but then [[George O'Malley]] asked her to listen to his heart. She did and then called for a cardio consult.

[[Erica Hahn]] listened to his heart and heard atrial fibrillation and prescribed blood thinners and an outpatient workup because he wasn't symptomatic. However, he later had a cardiac episode. He had a ventricular septal defect. They took him into surgery to repair the defect.

After his surgery, he thanked Bailey, saying he wouldn't have made it through the day without her. Marcus then proceeded to ask her if she had finished doing his paperwork, making Bailey realize that he was taking advantage of her.



When he was in high school, Miranda Bailey was his tutor. Because she had a serious crush on him, she ended up doing most of his homework for him. When he came into the hospital as an adult, he talked her into doing all his paperwork for him.


He works at a high school. Part of his job involved taking a set of students on a tour of colleges.


*He was  at the time of the accident.
*He ran track in high school.

'''Marcy''' came to the hospital to donate part of her liver to her sister, Karen.


Marcy's sister, Karen, was in liver failure. Marcy was a match and agreed to donate part of her liver to her sister. While they were hospitalized, Marcy pestered Karen by constantly talking about this wonderful thing she was doing for Karen and how she was missing her family vacation to do it.

Karen told Marcy that she knew that Marcy would hold the liver donation over her head for the rest of their lives. They fought over it and Karen said that she didn't want Marcy's liver anymore. However, Karen began to cough up blood, a sign of end-stage liver failure. Karen agreed to accept Marcy's liver.

After the surgery, Karen and Marcy started to fight again. Karen said that Marcy was never allowed to mention the liver again or she would reveal some of Marcy's secrets. When they continued to fight even after that, Meredith silenced both of them, saying they were in time out.



Marcy is married to a man named Harry. They have at least two children, including one named Kaylee.


Marcy skipped her family vacation to donate part of her liver to her sister, Karen. She constantly reminded Karen of all the things she had done for her, much to Karen's annoyance.


*The liver transplant was Marcy's first major surgery.
*She once lost thousands of dollars in a lipstick selling Ponzi scheme.
*She sometimes sexts her college boyfriend.

'''Margaret''' is a patient who had a history of breaks who was found to have a parathyroid tumor.


Margaret came into the hospital with a broken hip. She'd previously tripped on the sidewalk and cracked a rib, fallen in a shower and broken her arm, and broken two fingers doing yoga. George suggested they run more tests to find the cause.

They found a parathyroid tumor, which they determined to be benign and easy to remove. They scheduled surgery to remove the tumor. Afterward, she declared that she was going to Denver to be with the guy she'd had to break up with due to the tumor.



She was in love with a guy, but he had to move to Denver and she couldn't move with him because of her constant broken bones. After she had her tumor removed, she decided to go to Denver to be with him.


*The hip was her\uasixth break in a year.

'''Marie Lamott''' is the wife of [[Henry Lamott]].


Marie's husband, Henry, was in the hospital waiting to receive a spinal implant to relieve the pain of his herniated disk. Because of his allergy to all pain medications, his doctor prescribed the use of pornography to reduce his pain to a manageable level until his implant was in place.

When the power went out at the hospital, Henry's pain worsened without access to pornography. Realizing that he was really in pain without it, Cristina sat down with him and told him an erotic story to reduce his pain.



She is married to [[Henry Lamott]]. She said she's okay with his use of pornography to take away his pain because he takes away her pain.


She and her husband have at least two children. When the storm knocked out the power, they were dismissed early from school and she had to go pick them up.


*She knits.

'''Marina Wagner''' is a patient with colon cancer whose chemo drugs combined with an herbal supplement she took to create a neurotoxin.


Marina had had a large tumor removed from her colon eight months prior and she had chemo and radiation. They thought it had cured her, but she was back in the hospital after she woke up barely breathing. Her boyfriend, [[Vincent]], brought her in and was shocked to learn that she had cancer as she hadn't told him.

While drawing Marina's blood, George started shaking, though he thought it was due to something else. He handed her blood off and went to the clinic to lie down. However, when [[Olivia Jankovic|Olivia Harper]] and a lab tech ended up in the clinic as well, George figured out that Marina's blood was toxic due to a combination of her chemo drugs and an herbal supplement she was taking and called the OR. However, Marina had already been taken into the OR for a bowel resection. By the time he called, the OR staff had already collapsed from the effects of the neurotoxin.

In order to finish her surgery, they borrowed ortho suits. However, before they could finish getting ready, Marina started to wake up, so Addison had to go in to put her back under. Burke and Derek, then suited up, went in. They were able to complete the bowel resection, but didn't have time to close before they ran out of air. So the interns took turns going into the OR to pack her abdomen and do a temporary closure so she was stable for transport. She was then taken to ICU and given special dialysis to remove the toxin from her blood.



She is dating [[Vincent]]. They live in the same building and he thought she was sexy when she folded clothes. They'd been dating for a few months and it got serious fast. When she woke up after surgery, she told him she'd hoped that all the bad stuff was behind her, which is why she didn't tell him.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Wagner, Marina Rose}}

'''Marla Kristler''' came into the ER after the meth lab she was running exploded.


Marla was cooking meth in her apartment when it exploded. She was severely injured, including a skull fracture and abdominal injuries. She was taken into the ER where her injuries were assessed and then into surgery.

After her surgery, she woke up and was told her husband had been arrested for the meth lab and the police would probably want to speak with her as well.



She is married to [[Dave Kristler]]. When Dave lost his job, they started to cook crystal meth to make ends meet.


She and her husband have a son, [[Brian Kristler|Brian]]. While they cooked meth, he passively ingested it. After the meth lab exploded, his grandmother came to take him because his parents were arrested.


Marla and Dave are friends with their neighbor, [[Archie Roche]]. He sometimes babysat Brian. When he found out that they had been cooking meth, he was shocked and disappointed.

'''Marshall Stone''' is a surgical intern who caused an accident when he fell asleep while driving.


Marshall attempted to drive home from work after staying late to watch a surgery and fell asleep at the wheel, which caused him to hit a car containing [[Jim Johnson|Jim]] and [[Betty Johnson]], which in turn caused them to hit a car containing [[Noah Reynolds|Noah]] and [[Melanie Reynolds]].

When Marshall came into the ER, he was confused about what had happened. His wrist was injured, so they called ortho while [[Derek Shepherd]] did a neuro exam and ordered a CT. Marshall was unable to recall four words less than a minute after being told them.

Callie reduced and splinted his wrist and they waited for CT to be free. While he was waiting for the CT, Marshall got up and left. He went to the operating gallery and watched Melanie's surgery.

His CT was clear. Derek said the memory loss was from the concussion, but he wanted to keep him overnight to observe him.

Marshall asked to apologize to Melanie's family. Her father was brought to his hospital room. Marshall apologized and after a moment where Jim looked very angry at him, he placed his hand on Marshall's face and they both cried.


Marshall is a surgical intern at [[Mercy West Medical Center]]. He caused a car accident by falling asleep at the wheel after staying longer at work to observe a surgery.

'''Mary Daltrey''' is a paramedic who caused an ambulance crash when she had a seizure while driving.


Mary was driving an ambulance to the hospital when she had a seizure and crashed into another ambulance in the ambulance bay. She was postictal after the crash and had a bad elbow dislocation.

Callie reduced her elbow in the ER and Derek examined her and ordered an MRI. The MRI revealed a brain tumor, which had caused the seizure. They needed to do a cookie craniotomy and use a scope to remove the tumor. Before her surgery, she had another seizure.

They took her into surgery, but the navigational system died during the surgery, meaning Derek had no way of knowing where he was going in her brain. ''("[[Crash Into Me, Part ]]")''

They were able to fix the navigational system and finish the surgery. Mary was expected to make a full recovery. ''("[[Crash Into Me, Part ]]")''



[[Shane]] is her partner. Unbeknownst to her, he is a neo-Nazi.


Mary is a paramedic in Seattle. [[Shane]] is her partner.

'''Mary Levangie''' is [[Edward Levangie|Edward Levangie's]] daughter.


Mary's father, Edward had Parkinson's disease. He was admitted to the hospital to manage his back pain, but Mary, knowing that her father liked skinny blondes, asked Meredith to encourage him to have deep brain stimulation, as she was getting married and wanted him to be able to walk her down the aisle. He was reluctant, but ultimately agreed. The surgery was successful and he was able to walk down the hallway with his daughter afterward.



Mary was engaged to be married.


Mary was close to her father. She was worried about him because she'd already lost her mother, so when he had the chance to have surgery that would improve his quality of life, she pressured him to have it.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Levangie, Mary}}

'''Matthew Savoy''' is a doctor who questioned Bailey's decisions regarding [[Izzie Stevens|Izzie]] and [[Denny Duquette, Jr.|Denny]].


During the Morbidity and Mortality conference, while Denny Duquette was being discussed, Matthew said that they all knew that an intern cut Denny's LVAD wire and asked why they weren't hearing from Dr. Bailey instead. When Bailey took the stage, Matthew asked her about her having recently given birth and suggested she might be sleep-deprived. He also wondered why she lost track of her interns during that time.

After the M&M, Matthew tried to tell Bailey it wasn't personal, but she said it seemed personal to her. Because of their conversation, she declined to hold a patient's baby, not wanting to appear soft.

Later, Matthew saw Bailey holding a patient's son and asked her about it. She admitted to what she was doing and warned him to stay away because she was feeling a rush of hormones.


He is a doctor at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].

{{DEFAULTSORT:Savoy, Matthew}}

{{Intern and Resident Infobox |image = xMeganMostow.png |name = Megan Nowland |status = Alive |title = M.D. |marital = [[Steve Mostow]] ''(ex-husband)'' |children = Child ''(with [[Steve Mostow|Steve]])'' |job = [[General Surgery|Surgical]] [[Resident]] |workplace = '''Current'''
[[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]]
'''Former'''
[[Seattle Grace Hospital]] |first appearance = [[A Change is Gonna Come]] |last appearance = [[State of Love and Trust]] |count = |seasons = *'''[[Grey's Anatomy|GA]]:''' [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]], and [[Season (Grey's Anatomy)|]] *'''[[Seattle Grace: On Call]]''' |portrayed by = [[Molly Kidder]] }} '''Megan Nowland''' is a [[General Surgery|surgical]] [[Resident|resident]] at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]], formerly [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. On the first day of her internship, she was assigned to [[Meredith Grey]], who took them on a tour of the hospital and used the same new intern speech that Bailey had used for her class to introduce them to the rules, though she went on a tangent in the on-call room, telling them not to sleep with anyone else, especially not attendings. At the end of the day, all the new interns were in awe of George, who had delivered a baby that day, on what they all thought was his first ever shift as an intern. ''("[[A Change is Gonna Come]]")'' When the rumor spread that Callie and Izzie were going to fight in the hospital cafeteria, the interns, along with several other hospital staffers, gathered to watch it happen. However, Callie hadn't intended to fight and the interns were disappointed, calling it a forfeit on Callie's part. ''("[[The Heart of the Matter]]")'' Megan told Steve that Henry, presumably another intern, was observing in [[Tricia Hale|Tricia Hale's]] surgery when Mark Sloan announced to the whole OR that [[Izzie Stevens]] and [[George O'Malley]] had broken up. ''("[[Forever Young]]")'' Lucy and Meredith's other interns worked on Meredith and Derek's tumor trial. ''("[[Piece of My Heart]]")'' They later had to organize and collate trial patients. Meredith threatened them with scut if they missed a paper. ''("[[Freedom, Part ]]")'' When [[George O'Malley]] became a resident and the other residents had to choose an intern each to give to him, they lined all the interns up in the cafeteria and discussed their pros and cons right in front of them as they decided. ''("[[There's No 'I' in Team]]")'' The interns continued to practice and were joined by [[Sadie Harris]]. Cristina became suspicious when Lexie knew the parallel pulley stitch, something she hadn't taught her, which led to her discovering what they were doing. She told them to shut it down. ''("[[These Ties That Bind]]")'' The interns then gave Steve an epidural to practice. ''("[[In the Midnight Hour]]")'' The interns wanted to remove Steve's appendix while he was on the epidural, but he refused, so Sadie volunteered as long as she could remove one of theirs when they were done. They numbed her and Lexie used a book to guide her as she prepared to operate. When she hesitated, Sadie took the scalpel and made the first cut herself. When Lexie got to the appendix, it was inflamed, meaning this wasn't a routine procedure. Graciella said they should call a resident and then decided to leave when they wouldn't do it. Cristina then figured out that they hadn't shut it down like she told them to. Lexie came to Meredith because Sadie became unstable. Meredith and Cristina took over the surgery. They sent for Bailey and managed to save Sadie's life. The interns were then called in to present her case, admitting that they made choices that compromised her care. They were all then placed on probation until further notice. ''("[[In the Midnight Hour]]")'' Leo, Sadie, and Megan all had to work with Izzie in the clinic for a day. When they did procedures on patients, she also had them perform them on her. ''("[[Beat Your Heart Out]]")'' Wanting to remind the interns, who were still on probation, why they loved medicine, [[Izzie Stevens]] put together a medical contest for them, which involved diagnosing patients based on symptoms presented to them and draping patients for specific surgeries. ''("[[Before and After]]")'' After finding out she had cancer, Izzie took her scans and lab results and showed them to the interns, challenging them to diagnosis a patient she called "Patient X." ''("[[An Honest Mistake]]")'' They continued working on Patient X and presented a few ideas to Izzie. After more tests, they decided that Patient X was fine, before Izzie told them she was not fine. At the end of the day, they presented their final diagnosis: metastatic melanoma, with mets to the skin, liver, and brain. Her prognosis was very poor. They asked Izzie what their prize was, but she said the prize is that they didn't screw it up. ''("[[I Will Follow You Into the Dark]]")'' When [[David Young]] came into the hospital for his face transplant, the interns were prepared for his surgery and were told they'd likely never see another one again. ''("[[Stand By Me]]")'' Megan found out that she was pregnant after sleeping with Steve while on a break with Pierce. ''("[[Stand By Me]]")'' When Izzie went into surgery to have the mets removed from her brain, the interns waited outside the OR. The residents let them because people are better than no people. ''("[[Elevator Love Letter]]")'' Megan was affected by George's death. ''("[[Good Mourning]]")'' When the merger between [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] and [[Mercy West Medical Center]] was announced, the interns all began working around the clock, because they were scared to go home out of fear that they'd end up getting cut from the program. Cristina had Pierce, Megan, and Leo spy on the Chief for her and report back what they saw. Megan was ultimately fired as part of the first round of layoffs. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")'' After she was fired, she filed a lawsuit against the hospital, claiming they fired her because she was pregnant. ''("[[Invasion]]")'' Megan agreed to participate in a documentary someone was making about the doctors at the hospital only because she expected to get paid for it. ''("[[Seattle Grace: On Call]]")'' Wanting to give her a fresh start, [[Derek Shepherd]] re-hired Megan when he was appointed Chief. ''("[[State of Love and Trust]]")'' [[Pierce Halley]] Pierce was dating Megan at some point, but they broke up when Megan found a nurse's phone number in his scrubs. During their break, Megan slept with [[Steve Mostow|Steve]] and Steve accidentally sent an email to people about their hookup, including Pierce. According to [[Ryan Spalding|Ryan]], Pierce wanted to kill Steve. Pierce fought him leaving Steve with a bloody hand, almost broken and himself with a black eye. ''("[[Stand By Me]]")'' [[Steve Mostow]] Later, Megan and Steve were married by Steve's uncle, with Graciella as a witness. On New Year's Eve, Pierce demanded that Megan get a paternity test, claiming that he could be the father. She was conflicted over the test, fearing that if the baby was Pierce's, Steve would be devastated. But even when the results confirmed the father was Steve, he divorced her. ''("[[Seattle Grace: On Call]]")'' Originally one of [[Meredith Grey|Meredith Grey's]] [[Internship|interns]], Megan became a [[Resident|resident]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]]. She wanted to become a [[Pediatric Surgery|pediatric surgeon]]. During the merger of Settle Grace and Mercy West, she was cut from the program. ''("[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]]")'' After being fired, by email, she decided to sue the hospital for wrongful termination, claiming they fired her due to her pregnancy. ''("[[Invasion]]")'' When [[Derek Shepherd]] became [[Chief of Surgery]], he hired Megan back, telling her that even if there would be other cutbacks, he wanted to give her another chance to prove her value as a doctor. *After Megan was hired back after the merger between [[Seattle Grace Hospital]] and [[Mercy West Medical Center]], she was never seen or mentioned again. *She took piano lessons.[[Seattle Grace: On Call]] *She and Steve lived at Wentworth Street when they were married.[[Seattle Grace: On Call]] *She would like to see Disneyland in Paris.[[Seattle Grace: On Call]] *She hates surprises.[[Seattle Grace: On Call]] InternMegan.png|[[A Change is Gonna Come]] InternMegan.png|[[Let the Truth Sting]] InternsLucyandMegan.png|[[The Heart of the Matter]] InternMegan.png|[[Forever Young]] InternMegan.png|[[Piece of My Heart]] InternMegan.png|[[Freedom, Part ]] InternsLucyandMegan.png|[[Dream a Little Dream of Me, Part ]] Interns.png|[[Here Comes the Flood]] InternsMeganandDani.png|[[Brave New World]] InternsLisaandMegan.png|[[There's No 'I' in Team]] InternMegan.png|[[Life During Wartime]] InternMegan.png|[[In the Midnight Hour]] Interns.png|[[Sympathy for the Devil]] InternMegan.png|[[Beat Your Heart Out]] Interns.png|[[Before and After]] InternMegan.png|[[An Honest Mistake]] InternMegan.png|[[I Will Follow You Into the Dark]] InternMegan.png|[[Stand By Me]] InternsPierceRyanandMegan.png|[[Elevator Love Letter]] xMeganGraciella.png|[[Good Mourning]] xMeganMostow.png|[[I Always Feel Like Somebody's Watchin' Me]] xMeganMostow.png|[[State of Love and Trust]] x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg x-.jpg {{Megan Nowland Appearances}} {{Scrollbox}} [[fr:Megan Nowland]] [[de:Megan Nowland]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Nowland, Megan}} [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:GA Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:GA S Characters]] [[Category:Webisode Characters]] [[Category:Doctors]]

'''Megan Shelley''' is one of three siblings who came into the hospital to have their stomachs removed after they tested positive for a gene that causes gastric cancer.


All three Shelley siblings tested positive for a gene that gave them a / chance of getting gastric cancer, which had killed off most of their family. Because of this, they decided to get prophylactic gastrectomies.

When he heard about the possible side effects of the surgery, Mike backed out and Megan briefly backed out as well. However, after they found stage I cancer during Tricia's surgery, Megan agreed to have hers. The surgery went well and she was awake and said the pain was minimal afterward.



Due to the gastric cancer gene running in their family, the Shelley family was down to a branch. They had lost their mother, grandfather, aunt, and uncle to the disease and had a cousin in hospice care.


*She was  at the time of her gastrectomy.

'''Melanie Reynolds''' came to the hospital after being in a car accident with her family and ended up dying.


Melanie and her husband, Noah, were in a car when [[Marshall Stone]] fell asleep at the wheel and hit the car behind them, holding Melanie's parents, which then slammed into them. Melanie's side took all the impact. In the ER, she insisted that she was fine and just wanted the doctors to check on her baby.

They took her for a CT, which revealed catastrophic internal injuries. The adrenaline from the car accident had kept her conscious and pain-free. When she was in CT, she started to relax and she crashed. They rushed her to the OR. It quickly became clear that there wasn't much they could do, so they went into damage control mode. They operated, removing her spleen, until she reached the triangle of death, then the packed her and took her to the ICU. They later took her back into the OR, where they tried again to save her. They removed part of her lung, but she started coding. Alex was sent to get Addison to deliver the baby, but she was with another patient. By the time he got back to the OR, Melanie was dying. Knowing he had only a few minutes to save the baby, he did a c-section, talked through it by [[Miranda Bailey]]. The c-section was successful and after a few minutes, the baby started breathing. Melanie was pronounced dead not long after her baby was born.



She was married to [[Noah Reynolds]] until her death. They met when Noah went to college in Alabama.


Melanie's parents came to town for her baby shower. Her parents were very protective of her. Her father ignored the doctors' orders to stay on the backboard in order to make sure that Melanie and her baby were okay. Melanie's mother said they were very close and Melanie asked her advice on everything. Her baby was born shortly before Melanie was pronounced dead.


*She was  at the time of her death.
*She was pronounced dead at :.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Reynolds, Melanie}}

'''Melinda Prescott''' is the mother of [[Jackson Prescott]].


Melinda came into the hospital with her son, Jackson, who'd had  prior bowel resections. He was in the hospital for another surgery. When his doctor, [[Jordan Kenley]], died while examining him, his case was taken over by [[Arizona Robbins]], who didn't believe the current course of treatment was the right one and instead changed his treatment plan. Bailey told Melinda about this change and said that Jackson had a crackerjack new doctor. ''("[[Wish You Were Here]]")''

As Jackson's condition continued to decline, Melinda had to fight constantly with the insurance company, causing Jackson to ask Bailey to tell her something good that day, even if nothing good happened. When a set of organs became available, the doctors retrieved them and went to transplant them, but a black spot on the tissue meant that organs were unsuitable for transplant. They did a portacaval shunt to buy some time and closed. ''("[[Sympathy for the Devil]]")''

When Jackson's ICP continued to rise despite them putting him on liver dialysis, Melinda begged him to keep fighting, saying it wasn't time for him to go yet. His condition deteriorated and Melinda began to believe he was going to die. Bailey told her to come be with him because the time had come. So she held him and rocked him and said it was okay to go. However, Webber then came in to tell them they'd found organs. Jackson was rushed into surgery for the transplant. The transplant was successful and Melinda sat by his bedside afterward. He later woke up and asked for water. ''("[[Stairway to Heaven]]")''



Her son, Jackson, was hospitalized with liver and bowel disease. She worked very hard to make sure he had everything he needed.


She and [[Miranda Bailey]] bonded during her son's hospitalizations and got along well.

'''Melissa Keyser''' is a patient at [[Seattle Grace Mercy West Hospital]] who had kidney failure.


Melissa was on dialysis for kidney failure. She had exhausted all viable veins, which caused sepsis. With advice from [[Meredith Grey]], [[Heather Brooks]] suggested that [[Miranda Bailey]] try an artificial artery.

The surgery to implant the artificial artery was successful and after surgery, Melissa woke up and was able to interact with her family.



Melissa is married and has two children. They were all worried about her when she went into sepsis. After her surgery, they were seen interacting with her happily.


*She was  at the time of her hospitalization.

'''Mia Hanson''' is a little girl who was hospitalized after being run over by her nanny.


Mia was playing in the driveway when her nanny, [[Anna]], backed over her in an SUV on her way to the store to get milk.

She was taken to the ER where they assessed her injuries and then sent her up to CT. In CT, Mia was scared and wanted Anna, whom her mother had dismissed in the ER. Her mother tried singing her the goodnight song to get her to stay still for the CT, but Mia said she was singing it wrong and that she wanted Anna.

They took Mia into surgery where they repaired the damage. After her surgery, she was stable and they said she'd be taken for an MRI for her skull fracture, but hopefully wouldn't need any more surgery. The MRI showed bleeding in Mia's brain, so Derek said she needed to have brain surgery.

Mia had her second surgery and was awake and stable afterward. She continued to asked for Anna and her mother eventually relented and went to get Anna from the waiting room. Reunited, Anna and Mia sang the good night song together.



Mia's parents, while they love her, are not heavily involved in her day-to-day life, leaving the majority of the child care to their nanny, [[Anna]].


Mia is very close to her nanny, Anna. They have a special good night song that they sing together. When Mia was in the hospital, she repeatedly asked for Anna to comfort her.


*She was five at the time of her hospitalization.
*Her blood type is A-.
*She's allergic to penicillin and wheat.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Hanson, Mia}}

'''Michael''' is a kid who convinced Izzie to treat a deer that had been injured.


Michael and his father, Chris, came into the ER. Chris had an arm with him, [[Nancy Walters|Nancy Walters']] arm. Michael was shouting about a "she" who was bleeding in their truck. The doctors grabbed supplies and ran out to the truck only to discover that the "she" was a deer. Despite Chris's insistence that Michael didn't need them to do pretend medicine on the deer, Izzie and her interns jumped in to save the deer.

They were able to save the deer and an animal rescue came and took the deer away.



His dad thinks he needs to grow up and learn to face things.

'''Michael Beglight''' is the father of [[Shawn Beglight]].


Michael's son, Shawn, was hit in the head while playing baseball and vomited, so Michael and his husband, [[Rick Beglight|Rick]], took him to the hospital. They did a neuro exam and got a CT. The CT showed a small amount of blood in his ventricle, but Derek believed it would resolve itself, so he kept him for observation.

During a later neuro check, he was altered, so Meredith believed he had acute hydrocephalus from a clot. They drilled a burr hole in his hospital room to relieve the pressure. Once they drained the blood, he stabilized and woke up. Rick insisted on staying in the room while they drilled the burr hole, but after it was done, he vomited on [[Debbie|Nurse Debbie]].



He is married to [[Rick Beglight]]. They have one son together.


Compared to his husband, he is Shawn's more laid-back parent. When Shawn was injured playing baseball, he assured his husband that Shawn would be okay.

{{DEFAULTSORT:Beglight, Michael}}

'''Michael Norris''' was Erica Hahn's patient whose heart was stolen by [[Izzie Stevens]] for [[Denny Duquette, Jr.|Denny]].



Michael Norris was on the heart transplant list waiting for a new heart. He was entered into the donor list  seconds before Denny Duquette. When two donor hearts became available at Mercy West Medical Center, Erica Hahn went to retrieve Michael's and Preston Burke to retrieve Denny's. After Denny's donor died, Burke fought over Michael's donor's heart. After calling UNOS, they confirmed that Michael was higher on the list than Denny by a very small margin, but being entered into the list  seconds earlier gave him the edge. After Izzie found this out, she lied and said that Denny was getting worse, hoping to move his status up so he'd get the heart. When they asked her to confirm with tests, she cut Denny's LVAD wire to worsen his condition so she could get tests results that said he was in worse condition. The heart ultimately went to Denny, causing Michael to go back on the transplant list. ''("[[ Seconds]]")''


He later came to Seattle Grace to have a procedure done by his doctor, Erica Hahn.

Hahn picked Izzie to assist with the case and Izzie found out that it was the man she stole the heart from. His first procedure failed and he almost went home, but Izzie talked him back into doing a second procedure, which was a success. Hahn said she bought him some time, but he still needed a new heart. ''("[[Rise Up]]")''



He is married to [[Elyse Norris]]. They have two kids together.


He has two children with his wife.


Erica said that she doesn't get close to patients, but she really liked Michael.


*He was  at the time of his alcohol ablation.
*He's the last patient to be treated on-screen by\ua[[Erica Hahn|Dr. Erica Hahn]] at [[Seattle Grace Hospital]].

'''Michael Shelley''' is one of three siblings who came into the hospital to have their stomachs removed after they tested positive for a gene that causes gastric cancer.


All three Shelley siblings tested positive for a gene that gave them a / chance of getting gastric cancer, which had killed off most of their family. Because of this, they decided to get prophylactic gastrectomies.

When he heard the possible side effects, Mike decided not to have the surgery, hoping he'd be the -in- not to get the cancer. Megan also decided to back out, though after they found a tumor in Tricia's stomach, she changed her mind and had the surgery. Mike, however, didn't change his mind. Though Tricia pledged to keep on him until he finally had the surgery.



He has a girlfriend.


Due to the gastric cancer gene running in their family, the Shelley family was down to a branch. They had lost their mother, grandfather, aunt, and uncle to the disease and had a cousin in hospice care.


*He was  at the time of his hospitalization.
*He's the president of his fraternity.
*He goes snowboarding.
*He likes jelly beans.

'''Michelle Begler''' is the mother of [[Tori Begler]].


Michelle came to the hospital when her daughter, Tori, was there to have a large abdominal tumor removed. The whole family was worried about her and stayed with her to make sure she didn't get lonely. Tori's surgery went well and she was stable afterward.



She is married to [[Randy Begler]].


The Beglers are a very close family. When Tori was hospitalized, several members of her family came to the hospital to be with her, to make sure she was okay.

'''Miguel Ruiz''' is the father of Matthew Ruiz, who died in a plane crash.


Miguel and his wife, Gilda, came to the hospital when their son, Matthew, was in a plane crash. At the hospital, [[Miranda Bailey]] informed them that their son's body had been identified. After he made a call to someone, they were going to leave, but after hearing that the family of the lone survivor hadn't arrived, they decided to stay. Them staying prompted several other families to stay. Lexie gave them periodic updates until her mother arrived. When [[Mrs. Gordon]] arrived, they offered her coffee and sat with her until her daughter was out of surgery. Gilda also lied and said that her son would be fine when Mrs. Gordon asked about him. After she left, Gilda began to cry.



He is married to [[Gilda Ruiz]].


His son, Matthew, died in a plane crash.

'''Milo''' is a friend of [[David Young]].


Milo came to the hospital to see her friend, Dave, when he was having a face transplant. He initially asked her and the others to leave the room, not wanting them to see his scarred face, but later let them in and was shocked when they compared his face to orchids, their shared love. After his surgery, they got a sneak preview of his face.



[[David Young|David]], [[Shayna]], Milo, and [[Dexter]] all met on a message board for orchid lovers. When David was in the hospital for a face transplant, the others came to be with him. He initially refused to see them because he didn't want them to see his face pre-transplant, but he ultimately let them come in and they didn't see him as ugly.
